subject: abuse
poem_text:
The bruise blooms dark where no eye dares to wander.  
A shadow lingers, mute against the skin.  

A shadow lingers, mute against the skin,  
Its whispers buried deep beneath the bone.  

Its whispers buried deep beneath the bone—  
The body knows what the mind won’t speak of.  

The body knows what the mind won’t speak of,  
Each startling touch a prayer turned to ash.  

Each startling touch a prayer turned to ash,  
The ache we carry carved along our backs.  

The ache we carry carved along our backs,  
A hymn etched where forgiveness fears to tread.  

A hymn etched where forgiveness fears to tread,  
The bruise blooms dark where no eye dares to wander.

subject: abuse
poem_text:
The silence thickens where the shouting fades—  
It keeps its weight, though nothing else remains.  

It keeps its weight, though nothing else remains,  
Pressed into walls that once could hold my name.  

Pressed into walls that once could hold my name,  
A voice lives there, unthreading every claim.  

A voice lives there, unthreading every claim,  
Its tone a ghost that whispers only blame.  

Its tone a ghost that whispers only blame,  
Each echo proof I was the one to maim.  

Each echo proof I was the one to maim—  
How long before I vanish, just the same?  

How long before I vanish, just the same?  
The silence thickens where the shouting fades.

subject: abuse
poem_text:
The mirror shattered, shards across the floor.  
The glass still shows me who I was before.  

The glass still shows me who I was before—  
A face I’d learned to flinch from, not adore.  

A face I’d learned to flinch from, not adore—  
Frozen by sounds of him behind the door.  

Frozen by sounds of him behind the door,  
The lock clicks, terror sinks into my core.  

The lock clicks, terror sinks into my core—  
My fingers trace the cracks I can’t ignore.  

My fingers trace the cracks I can’t ignore:  
His voice, the wreckage I keep reaching for.  

His voice, the wreckage I keep reaching for—  
The mirror shattered, shards across the floor.

subject: activities
poem_text:
I stretch my limbs to greet the quiet dawn,  
The day unfolds in murmurs soft and slow.  

The day unfolds in murmurs soft and slow—  
Each moment sways like shadows on the floor.  

Each moment sways like shadows on the floor,  
A dance of tasks that pull against their weight.  

A dance of tasks that pull against their weight,  
Yet still, I move as if to find some joy.  

Yet still, I move as if to find some joy,  
The rhythm fills each empty, fleeting beat.  

The rhythm fills each empty, fleeting beat,  
And binds the hours in loops of sound and sweat.  

And binds the hours in loops of sound and sweat—  
I stretch my limbs to greet the quiet dawn.

subject: activities
poem_text:
I heard the days slip through my careless hands.  
Time was a thread unraveling in the dark.  

Time was a thread unraveling in the dark,  
I stitched with tasks and still unspooled the seams.  

I stitched with tasks and still unspooled the seams,  
Building a tower that sank as I climbed.  

Building a tower that sank as I climbed,  
I chased my name through mirrors warped with ghosts.  

I chased my name through mirrors warped with ghosts,  
Each task a shadow shaping what I lost.  

Each task a shadow shaping what I lost,  
The hours sang loud but felt of hollow brass.  

The hours sang loud but felt of hollow brass,  
I heard the days slip through my careless hands.

subject: activities
poem_text:
I lifted the hammer, the weight of the world,  
Each nail a promise trembling in my hand.  

Each nail a promise trembling in my hand,  
A map of hours scrawled on roughened wood.  

A map of hours scrawled on roughened wood,  
The walls rose slowly, splinters in my palms.  

The walls rose slowly, splinters in my palms,  
The house we built held whispers from the past.  

The house we built held whispers from the past,  
Your shadow lingered as I swung the tool.  

Your shadow lingered as I swung the tool,  
Echoes of laughter hid behind each beam.  

Echoes of laughter hid behind each beam,  
As if the hammer struck not wood, but air.  

I lifted the hammer, the weight of the world.

subject: arts & sciences
poem_text:
The brush’s arc reveals what the hands can’t say,  
A mute hymn rising in the whirl of hues.  

A mute hymn rising in the whirl of hues,  
The equation’s proof mirrors quiet truths.  

The equation’s proof mirrors quiet truths,  
Where numbers hum like strings in ancient air.  

Where numbers hum like strings in ancient air,  
I carve constellations from chaos and doubt.  

I carve constellations from chaos and doubt,  
Each canvas an orbit, each line a vein.  

Each canvas an orbit, each line a vein,  
An atom splits, and I paint its fracture.  

An atom splits, and I paint its fracture,  
The brush’s arc reveals what the hands can’t say.

subject: arts & sciences
poem_text:
The brush’s sweep invents a world untamed.  
Its edge creates a stillness sharp as bone.  

Its edge creates a stillness sharp as bone;  
The theorist maps the chaos into lines.  

The theorist maps the chaos into lines—  
A formula rebuilds both flesh and star.  

A formula rebuilds both flesh and star,  
While colors split the night into belief.  

While colors split the night into belief,  
A whisper charts old questions into breath.  

A whisper charts old questions into breath;  
Each stroke becomes the why inside the frame.  

Each stroke becomes the why inside the frame—  
The brush’s sweep invents a world untamed.

subject: arts & sciences
poem_text:
The lens turns heaven's black to brighter tones.  
Through glass, the cosmos whispers unseen truths.  

Through glass, the cosmos whispers unseen truths:  
A quiet hum of stars that never fade.  

A quiet hum of stars that never fade  
Lingers like ink on hands from written vows.  

Lingers like ink on hands from written vows—  
We trace their arcs in search of lost design.  

We trace their arcs in search of lost design,  
Each orbit sketched, a question in the air.  

Each orbit sketched, a question in the air,  
As if the void could grant a voice to light.  

As if the void could grant a voice to light,  
The lens turns heaven’s black to brighter tones.

subject: christianity
poem_text:
I held a cross, though it burned in my hand.  
The fire felt quiet, a tongue I could not trust.  

The fire felt quiet, a tongue I could not trust,  
Its whispers slipped past hope into silence.  

Its whispers slipped past hope into silence—  
Who kneels but still questions the hands they pray to?  

Who kneels but still questions the hands they pray to,  
Fingers trembling, unsure of heaven’s weight?  

Fingers trembling, unsure of heaven’s weight,  
Are we saved, or are we only wandering?  

Are we saved, or are we only wandering?  
The stars in the sky gave no holy answer.  

The stars in the sky gave no holy answer.  
I held a cross, though it burned in my hand.

subject: christianity
poem_text:
The light through stained glass fell on my tilted face.  
Its colors burned like wounds I dared not name.  

Its colors burned like wounds I dared not name,  
Each hue a heavy burden we called grace.  

Each hue a heavy burden we called grace,  
A choir of doubt that echoed in my chest.  

A choir of doubt that echoed in my chest—  
Their songs of praise left every question pressed.  

Their songs of praise left every question pressed,  
Yet silence carved the altar of my heart.  

Yet silence carved the altar of my heart,  
Each word I spoke became a work of art.  

Each word I spoke became a work of art;  
The light through stained glass fell on my tilted face.

subject: christianity
poem_text:
The cross above my father’s bed hangs low.  
Its shadow bends like prayers we’ve never said.  

Its shadow bends like prayers we’ve never said,  
Muted as whispers in a room of doubt.  

Muted as whispers in a room of doubt,  
Faith trembles where the wallpaper peels back.  

Faith trembles where the wallpaper peels back,  
Revealing cracks that time has failed to fill.  

Revealing cracks that time has failed to fill,  
I trace the wood-grain—splinters bite my palm.  

I trace the wood-grain—splinters bite my palm—  
His stillness feels like scripture breaking open.  

His stillness feels like scripture breaking open:  
The cross above my father’s bed hangs low.

subject: chronic illness
poem_text:
Pain blooms at dawn like an unwanted guest,  
The body betrays what the heart knows best.  

The body betrays what the heart knows best—  
A quiet war, though I beg it to rest.  

A quiet war, though I beg it to rest,  
Each breath an ache, each step a test.  

Each breath an ache, each step a test,  
The days stack heavy, yet I'm still obsessed.  

The days stack heavy, yet I'm still obsessed—  
To find some solace in what's repressed.  

To find some solace in what's repressed,  
I hold tight to hope like a whispered jest.  

I hold tight to hope like a whispered jest,  
Pain blooms at dawn like an unwanted guest.

subject: chronic illness
poem_text:
I wake to the weight of a thousand stones.  
This body, a house, resists its own spine.  

This body, a house, resists its own spine,  
The walls bend inward; the floors crack with time.  

The walls bend inward; the floors crack with time,  
Each breath a trespass, the air tastes of rust.  

Each breath a trespass, the air tastes of rust;  
No one warns you that mornings betray trust.  

No one warns you that mornings betray trust,  
That light splits the seams you’ve sewn in the dark.  

That light splits the seams you’ve sewn in the dark—  
A quiet war fought beneath tender marks.  

A quiet war fought beneath tender marks,  
I wake to the weight of a thousand stones.

subject: chronic illness
poem_text:
The pillbox rattles softly in my hands,  
A hard hymn that sings my breaking in shards.  

A hard hymn that sings my breaking in shards,  
Each capsule a prayer, a weight I must guard.  

Each capsule a prayer, a weight I must guard,  
Morning light pools where my will feels so barred.  

Morning light pools where my will feels so barred,  
The bed an ocean pulling me backward.  

The bed an ocean pulling me backward,  
I drift toward a surface I’ve long since marred.  

I drift toward a surface I’ve long since marred,  
Each dose a map of wounds I can’t discard.  

Each dose a map of wounds I can’t discard—  
The pillbox rattles softly in my hands.

subject: crime & punishment
poem_text:
The gavel falls, a thunder no one can flee.  
A weight of silence presses where sins once stood.  

A weight of silence presses where sins once stood,  
Like ghosts that haunt the corridors of the soul.  

Like ghosts that haunt the corridors of the soul,  
Guilt carves its lines, a chisel shaping stone.  

Guilt carves its lines, a chisel shaping stone,  
Each crack revealing wounds too slow to heal.  

Each crack revealing wounds too slow to heal,  
The sentence lingers longer than the crime.  

The sentence lingers longer than the crime,  
Time scrapes its nails against the edges of loss.  

Time scrapes its nails against the edges of loss,  
While hope grows dim, a flame behind the bars.  

The gavel falls, a thunder no one can flee.

subject: crime & punishment
poem_text:
The gavel strikes, and silence holds the room.  
A hand is trembling, grasping what it can.  

A hand is trembling, grasping what it can—  
The weight of what is owed consumes the air.  

The weight of what is owed consumes the air,  
And justice wears a mask of borrowed light.  

And justice wears a mask of borrowed light,  
Its shadow stretches longer than the sin.  

Its shadow stretches longer than the sin—  
A chain too cold to break, too sharp to bear.  

A chain too cold to break, too sharp to bear—  
The plea is met with echoes in the dark.  

The plea is met with echoes in the dark,  
No hand to lift the burden still falls down.  

The gavel strikes, and silence holds the room.

subject: crime & punishment
poem_text:
The cell at dusk hums low, a broken refrain.  
A hymn of rusted bars and mournful steel.  

A hymn of rusted bars and mournful steel,  
The echoes linger like the breath of guilt.  

The echoes linger like the breath of guilt—  
A clock that ticks but never moves ahead.  

A clock that ticks but never moves ahead,  
Each second nails the coffin of regret.  

Each second nails the coffin of regret,  
The moonlight carves the walls with crooked truth.  

The moonlight carves the walls with crooked truth,  
And shadows weigh as much as crimes confessed.  

And shadows weigh as much as crimes confessed—  
The cell at dusk hums low, a broken refrain.

subject: cycles
poem_text:
The moon returns to cast her silver song.  
A light too soft to stay where shadows cling.  

A light too soft to stay where shadows cling,  
Still trembling, lost, yet seeking something whole.  

Still trembling, lost, yet seeking something whole,  
Our hands reach out to touch what won’t remain.  

Our hands reach out to touch what won’t remain,  
Grasping echoes caught by time, then undone.  

Grasping echoes caught by time, then undone,  
We stain the earth with footprints of return.  

We stain the earth with footprints of return,  
Repeating paths we swore we’d never trace.  

Repeating paths we swore we’d never trace,  
The moon returns to cast her silver song.

subject: cycles
poem_text:
The sun returns to wake what the night undid.  
Its fingers trace the silence where dreams once stayed.  

Its fingers trace the silence where dreams once stayed,  
And darkness folds into dim light's careless robe.  

And darkness folds into dim light's careless robe,  
Unraveling what seemed eternal in the dusk.  

Unraveling what seemed eternal in the dusk,  
We rise again beneath a sky that drains like floods.  

We rise again beneath a sky that drains like floods,  
Each breath reshaped by hurts we've carried into dawn.  

Each breath reshaped by hurts we've carried into dawn,  
Yet every scar bears whispers of its stubborn song.  

Yet every scar bears whispers of its stubborn song—  
The sun returns to wake what the night undid.

subject: cycles
poem_text:
The Ferris wheel turns slow against the dusk.  
A spinning circle sways like time undone.  

A spinning circle sways like time undone—  
Its creak and groan recall a body’s ache.  

Its creak and groan recall a body’s ache,  
Rising, falling, then back to where it starts.  

Rising, falling, then back to where it starts,  
The view expands, then folds into itself.  

The view expands, then folds into itself,  
Lights trace the edges of a fleeting joy.  

Lights trace the edges of a fleeting joy—  
For moments, we are held above the ground.  

For moments, we are held above the ground,  
And vanish when the last light meets the dark.  

The Ferris wheel turns slow against the dusk.

subject: desire & passion
poem_text:
A hunger curls inside, sharp and alive,  
Its ache a whisper, tender yet devouring.  

Its ache a whisper, tender yet devouring—  
How need twists sweet and cruel, the same fire.  

How need twists sweet and cruel, the same fire  
That warms the hand but spreads through the chest.  

That warms the hand but spreads through the chest,  
Turning breath into smoke, body to ember.  

Turning breath into smoke, body to ember,  
We chase what leaves us scorched but gleaming.  

We chase what leaves us scorched but gleaming,  
A spark too brief to cradle but too bright to refuse.  

A spark too brief to cradle but too bright to refuse,  
A hunger curls inside, sharp and alive.

subject: desire & passion
poem_text:
I sought the heat where shadows dared to cling,  
The way fire hums beneath a quiet thing.  

The way fire hums beneath a quiet thing—  
I held the flame and prayed it wouldn’t singe.  

I held the flame and prayed it wouldn’t singe,  
But still, it licked my hand, a pleading hinge.  

And still, it licked my hand, a pleading hinge;  
Its whisper curled my breath into a sting.  

Its whisper curled my breath into a sting,  
And left me mute, undone by blinding wings.  

It left me mute, undone by blinding wings,  
The glow now fades, yet stays, a haunting ring.  

The glow now fades, yet stays, a haunting ring.  
I sought the heat where shadows dared to cling.

subject: desire & passion
poem_text:
The red silk scarf clung tight in the humid air,  
It whispered warmth, though I was cold to its touch.  

It whispered warmth, though I was cold to its touch,  
A ribbon of fire bound to my trembling hands.  

A ribbon of fire bound to my trembling hands,  
Its folds breathed secrets of lives I'd never known.  

Its folds breathed secrets of lives I’d never known,  
Each thread a map of longing, woven and taut.  

Each thread a map of longing, woven and taut—  
It crowded the room, though it weighed nearly nothing.  

It crowded the room, though it weighed nearly nothing,  
A single slip could unravel my resolve.  

A single slip could unravel my resolve,  
The red silk scarf clung tight in the humid air.

subject: doubt & contemplation
poem_text:
I hold my silence like a bird holds its breath.  
A stillness erupts, heavier than the air.  

A stillness erupts, heavier than the air—  
Its weight bends the branches I thought were mine.  

Its weight bends the branches I thought were mine,  
And cracks the sky I painted to feel whole.  

It cracks the sky I painted to feel whole;  
Who knew this ache could live beneath its blue?  

Who knew this ache could live beneath its blue,  
Where shadows falter and yet never retreat?  

Where shadows falter and yet never retreat,  
Each question seeds a forest I cannot leave.  

Each question seeds a forest I cannot leave.  
I hold my silence like a bird holds its breath.

subject: doubt & contemplation
poem_text:
I woke unsure if truth still knew my name.  
The mirror whispered back in fractured tones.  

The mirror whispered back in fractured tones,  
Its voice a hunger gnawed sharp in my chest.  

Its voice, a hunger, gnawed sharp in my chest,  
Left me to question the weight of my steps.  

Left me to question the weight of my steps:  
Could shadows mock the sun for burning dim?  

Could shadows mock the sun for burning dim,  
When every glow must flicker, fade, and fall?  

When every glow must flicker, fade, and fall,  
What shape does silence take when it’s unmet?  

What shape does silence take when it’s unmet?  
I woke unsure if truth still knew my name.

subject: doubt & contemplation
poem_text:
The lake refused its reflection back to me.  
A silver mirror fractured by trembling hands.  

A silver mirror fractured by trembling hands—  
Ripples unmaking the truth I thought I knew.  

Ripples unmaking the truth I thought I knew,  
Each wave a question folding into itself.  

Each wave a question folding into itself,  
And I stood still, afraid to reach for the answer.  

I stood still, afraid to reach for the answer—  
The branches above cast shadows like doubt.  

The branches above cast shadows like doubt,  
Their shapes shifting as the wind pulled them apart.  

Their shapes shifting as the wind pulled them apart,  
The lake refused its reflection back to me.

subject: family & ancestors
poem_text:
I carry the weight of voices I can't name.  
Their whispers seep through blood, a quiet flame.  

Their whispers seep through blood, a quiet flame,  
Stories untold, yet etched in my marrow.  

Stories untold, yet etched in my marrow,  
I am their echo, sharp in joy and sorrow.  

I am their echo, sharp in joy and sorrow,  
Lessons passed down in silence, not in sound.  

Lessons passed down in silence, not in sound—  
Each gesture a thread in a quilt unwound.  

Each gesture a thread in a quilt unwound,  
I stitch their love, though their faces stay blurred.  

I stitch their love, though their faces stay blurred,  
A chorus of shadows, alive in one word.  

I carry the weight of voices I can't name.

subject: family & ancestors
poem_text:
The air is thick with whispers I cannot name,  
It clings to me like shadows I can't unsee.  

It clings to me like shadows I can't unsee,  
A weight of voices humming low in my chest.  

The weight of voices humming low in my chest  
Presses me into stories I've not lived.  

Pressed into stories I've not lived, I ache  
For faces I know only through my dreams.  

The faces I know only through my dreams  
Rise up like tidewater, then pull away.  

They rise like tidewater, then pull away,  
Leaving salt in the hollows of my hands.  

Left with salt in the hollows of my hands,  
The air is thick with whispers I cannot name.

subject: family & ancestors
poem_text:
Her hands told stories carved in wrinkle and scar.  
The touch of worn fingers feels like fragile bark.  

The touch of worn fingers feels like fragile bark.  
She held me close, her warmth a glowing spark.  

She held me close, her warmth a glowing spark,  
While her voice wove tales of rain and lark.  

While her voice wove tales of rain and lark,  
Her breath hummed prayers against the looming dark.  

Her breath hummed prayers against the looming dark,  
Beneath her roof, both shelter and an ark.  

Beneath her roof, both shelter and an ark,  
I dreamed of roots she planted in the park.  

I dreamed of roots she planted in the park—  
Her hands told stories carved in wrinkle and scar.

subject: gender & sexuality
poem_text:
My body shifts like dusk between two skies,  
A shape that holds yet blurs what it divides.  

A shape that holds yet blurs what it divides,  
I wear myself in fragments, soft and untried.  

I wear myself in fragments, soft and untried,  
Each stitch unravels where silence collides.  

Each stitch unravels where silence collides,  
The seams of truth undone, no place to hide.  

The seams of truth undone, no place to hide—  
I grow a name that blooms, then breaks beside.  

I grow a name that blooms, then breaks beside,  
Its petals shed like whispers I confide.  

Its petals shed like whispers I confide,  
My body shifts like dusk between two skies.

subject: gender & sexuality
poem_text:
I walked through shadows to find my own face.  
Each step I took erased the paths they traced.  

Each step I took erased the paths they traced,  
A dance I learned in secret, out of place.  

A dance I learned in secret, out of place,  
The mirrors cracked where I had sought for grace.  

The mirrors cracked where I had sought for grace,  
Reflections formed a world I’d yet to chase.  

Reflections formed a world I’d yet to chase,  
Shapes softening in ways I dared embrace.  

Shapes softening in ways I dared embrace,  
An echo called that I could not erase.  

An echo called that I could not erase—  
I walked through shadows to find my own face.

subject: gender & sexuality
poem_text:
The mirror once taught me the shape of my face.  
Its silver mouth whispered a name I’d ignored.  

Its silver mouth whispered a name I’d ignored,  
Pressed against the skin I was told to betray.  

Pressed against the skin I was told to betray,  
I traced my reflection to find where I fit.  

I traced my reflection to find where I fit,  
But cracks in the glass made my edges unclear.  

But cracks in the glass made my edges unclear,  
As if the frame held a ghost I couldn’t be.  

As if the frame held a ghost I couldn’t be,  
I questioned the weight of every crooked line.  

I questioned the weight of every crooked line,  
The mirror once taught me the shape of my face.

subject: greek & roman mythology
poem_text:
The gods once walked where the mortal heart aches,  
Their laughter burned like fires through dark skies.  

Their laughter burned like fires through dark skies,  
Immortal pain masked by celestial pride.  

Immortal pain masked by celestial pride,  
Zeus’s throne hums with thunderous regrets.  

Zeus’s throne hums with thunderous regrets,  
Athena weeps where wisdom can’t mend wounds.  

Athena weeps where wisdom can’t mend wounds,  
Arachne spins her fate into fragile threads.  

Arachne spins her fate into fragile threads,  
The Fates themselves watch, silent, holding their shears.  

The Fates themselves watch, silent, holding their shears,  
Love and war are mirrors broken on the ground.  

The gods once walked where the mortal heart aches.

subject: greek & roman mythology
poem_text:
A god once whispered secrets into the sea,  
I listened close, mistaking salt for wisdom.  

I listened close, mistaking salt for wisdom,  
Dreaming of stars that burned in endless battle.  

Dreaming of stars that burned in endless battle,  
I prayed to idols carved from stone and hunger.  

I prayed to idols carved from stone and hunger,  
Their marble eyes untouched by flame or silence.  

Their marble eyes untouched by flame or silence,  
Reflected skies where echoes bled like serpents.  

Reflected skies where echoes bled like serpents,  
I wandered roads that coiled toward distant ruins.  

I wandered roads that coiled toward distant ruins,  
A god once whispered secrets into the sea.

subject: greek & roman mythology
poem_text:
The olive tree remembers where we knelt.  
Beneath its shade, we prayed to gods long gone.  

Beneath its shade, we prayed to gods long gone—  
Their whispers wrapped in branches, dusk-drawn songs.  

Their whispers wrapped in branches, dusk-drawn songs,  
A war of love and vengeance carved in stone.  

A war of love and vengeance carved in stone,  
Athena claimed this tree as her own breath.  

Athena claimed this tree as her own breath—  
I saw her shadow brush the bark like flame.  

I saw her shadow brush the bark like flame,  
And still, the leaves hid offerings of grief.  

And still, the leaves hid offerings of grief—  
The olive tree remembers where we knelt.

subject: history & politics
poem_text:
We walk on bones the earth cannot forget.  
Beneath each step, a shadow of regret.  

Beneath each step, a shadow of regret,  
Wars etched in soil where treaties were upset.  

Wars etched in soil where treaties were upset,  
The flags we raise still wave on blood and sweat.  

The flags we raise still wave on blood and sweat—  
A symbol, or a noose we can't unnet?  

A symbol, or a noose we can't unnet,  
Each promise breaks as truth and lie reset.  

Each promise breaks as truth and lie reset;  
The page may turn, but debt remains unmet.  

The page may turn, but debt remains unmet—  
We walk on bones the earth cannot forget.

subject: history & politics
poem_text:
In whispers, they build monuments of the past.  
The weight of stone hides what they could not confess.  

The weight of stone hides what they could not confess—  
A gilded pause where silence breaks like glass.  

A gilded pause where silence breaks like glass,  
Each word a ghost that shadows what once was.  

Each word a ghost that shadows what once was,  
Ink-stained with stories none dared to address.  

Ink-stained with stories none dared to address,  
Their echoes linger, soft, beneath the brass.  

Their echoes linger, soft, beneath the brass,  
Unfolding truths they swore would never last.  

Unfolding truths they swore would never last,  
In whispers, they build monuments of the past.

subject: history & politics
poem_text:
In the square, the bell hangs, a scarred hollow weight.  
Its fracture sings louder than any freedom.  

Its fracture sings louder than any freedom—  
The anthem bends in tongues of molten iron.  

The anthem bends in tongues of molten iron,  
Each note a ghost, each strike a new forgetting.  

Each note a ghost, each strike a new forgetting,  
The past lives here, but it whispers like smoke.  

The past lives here, but it whispers like smoke,  
Shrouded in fractures the eye doesn’t discern.  

Shrouded in fractures the eye doesn’t discern,  
The truth will not ring clear, will not resound clean.  

The truth will not ring clear, will not resound clean;  
Yet still we gather beneath its heavy arc.  

In the square, the bell hangs, a scarred hollow weight.

subject: home life
poem_text:
The walls remember the names we’ve whispered—  
Soft echoes bloom where silence once stood still.  

Soft echoes bloom where silence once stood still,  
The floor hums low, beneath the weight of us.  

The floor hums low, beneath the weight of us,  
Each creak a testament to what we bear.  

Each creak a testament to what we bear,  
The chairs hold their breath, watching our unrest.  

The chairs hold their breath, watching our unrest,  
Windows strain to filter the sun through shadows.  

Windows strain to filter the sun through shadows,  
Curtains breathe secrets spun from woven air.  

Curtains breathe secrets spun from woven air—  
The walls remember the names we’ve whispered.

subject: home life
poem_text:
The door creaks open, spilling light on the floor.  
A beam so faint it feels like a whispered breath.  

A beam so faint it feels like a whispered breath,  
Unseen hands stitching silence into the walls.  

Unseen hands stitching silence into the walls,  
Where shadowed echoes carry unspoken weight.  

Where shadowed echoes carry unspoken weight,  
A chair rocks itself in a rhythm of waiting.  

A chair rocks itself in a rhythm of waiting,  
Its wood worn soft by the ache of passing years.  

Its wood worn soft by the ache of passing years,  
The clock ticks sharp, slicing through tender hours.  

The clock ticks sharp, slicing through tender hours—  
The door creaks open, spilling light on the floor.

subject: home life
poem_text:
The kitchen light flickers under my hand—  
Its hum, a quiet hymn in the night.  

Its hum, a quiet hymn in the night,  
Threads warmth through the cracks of this house.  

Threads warmth through the cracks of this house,  
Where whispers roam and walls remember.  

Where whispers roam and walls remember,  
The table holds stains of lives we’ve eaten.  

The table holds stains of lives we’ve eaten,  
A ring of coffee, left from your morning.  

A ring of coffee, left from your morning,  
Marks time as if it could keep us whole.  

Marks time as if it could keep us whole,  
The kitchen light flickers under my hand.

subject: hope
poem_text:
The morning breaks beneath a veil of doubt,  
Its light a shiver crawling through the dark.  

Its light a shiver crawling through the dark,  
A fragile flame igniting winter’s cold.  

A fragile flame igniting winter’s cold,  
I hold it close like breath that wants to leave.  

I hold it close like breath that wants to leave,  
Afraid that yearning teaches loss too well.  

Afraid that yearning teaches loss too well,  
I plant my grief where fields can one day bloom.  

I plant my grief where fields can one day bloom,  
A tender promise whispered to the earth.  

A tender promise whispered to the earth,  
The morning breaks beneath a veil of doubt.

subject: hope
poem_text:
I buried a seed in the mouth of the night.  
The soil was dry, with no promise of rain.  

The soil was dry, with no promise of rain.  
Still, I pressed my palms to the earth and waited.  

Still, I pressed my palms to the earth and waited,  
Listening for whispers from roots in the dark.  

Listening for whispers from roots in the dark,  
I dreamed of green rising, though none could be seen.  

I dreamed of green rising, though none could be seen,  
A fragile stem bent toward a nameless light.  

A fragile stem bent toward a nameless light—  
What grows may falter, but it longs to move.  

What grows may falter, but it longs to move.  
I buried a seed in the mouth of the night.

subject: hope
poem_text:
The candle flickers, faint but fiercely holding on.  
Its light feels fragile, yet it warms the darkest room.  

Its light feels fragile, yet it warms the darkest room,  
A tender flame that pushes shadows into bloom.  

A tender flame that pushes shadows into bloom,  
How small it is—and still it dares defy the gloom.  

How small it is—and still it dares defy the gloom,  
Each match that struck before now whispers through the wound.  

Each match that struck before now whispers through the wound,  
A memory of fire softens what’s been doomed.  

A memory of fire softens what’s been doomed,  
As if the night surrenders when its edges swoon.  

As if the night surrenders when its edges swoon,  
The candle flickers, faint but fiercely holding on.

subject: humor & satire
poem_text:
The joke unravels like a thread undone,  
Each laugh a wound disguised as its own balm.  

Each laugh a wound disguised as its own balm,  
A mirror warped, betraying where we ache.  

A mirror warped, betraying where we ache,  
It makes us flinch, then forces us to grin.  

It makes us flinch, then forces us to grin,  
While truth stands wrapped in costumes, sharp and light.  

While truth stands wrapped in costumes, sharp and light,  
Its edge cuts deep, but we still beg for more.  

Its edge cuts deep, but we still beg for more—  
The punchline lands, a bruise beneath the rib.  

The punchline lands, a bruise beneath the rib,  
The joke unravels like a thread undone.

subject: humor & satire
poem_text:
Laughter's a knife cutting silence in the dark.  
Its edge gleams bright, a truth that blurs and bites.  

Its edge gleams bright, a truth that blurs and bites,  
It splits the air, revealing cracks in stone.  

It splits the air, revealing cracks in stone—  
A whisper turned gale, a mask split wide.  

A whisper turned gale, a mask split wide,  
Jokes cradle grief like fire born in frost.  

Jokes cradle grief like fire born in frost,  
They warm, they burn —then leave you cold, alone.  

They warm, they burn —then leave you cold, alone,  
What’s sharp in jest turns blunt in the wrong mouth.  

What’s sharp in jest turns blunt in the wrong mouth,  
Laughter's a knife cutting silence in the dark.

subject: humor & satire
poem_text:
The joke hung heavy in the room like smoke.  
I watched its warmth dissolve to silent cold.  

I watched its warmth dissolve to silent cold—  
A laugh half-formed can chill a fragile face.  

A laugh half-formed can chill a fragile face,  
Expression stiffening to something sharp.  

Expression stiffening to something sharp,  
A glance can twist the heart like spring-wound gears.  

A glance can twist the heart like spring-wound gears,  
No punchline saves the moment once it slips.  

No punchline saves the moment once it slips,  
The air now brittle as a shattered glass.  

The air now brittle as a shattered glass,  
The joke hung heavy in the room like smoke.

subject: indoor activities
poem_text:
The games we play beneath these quieted roofs—  
A breath caught between shelter and retreat.  

A breath caught between shelter and retreat,  
Soft shadows stretch where sunlight used to meet.  

Soft shadows stretch where sunlight used to meet,  
Stale air hums low, a chorus of defeat.  

Stale air hums low, a chorus of defeat,  
Cards splayed like days we shuffle, incomplete.  

Cards splayed like days we shuffle, incomplete,  
The walls grow tight as if they too compete.  

The walls grow tight as if they too compete,  
A puzzle turned inside, its edges fleet.  

A puzzle turned inside, its edges fleet—  
The games we play beneath these quieted roofs.

subject: indoor activities
poem_text:
I sit in shadows while the rain taps glass.  
Its rhythm urges me to pass the time.  

Its rhythm urges me to pass the time,  
A metronome for thoughts that drift in waves.  

A metronome for thoughts that drift in waves,  
The walls close in; my breath rewinds the hours.  

The walls close in; my breath rewinds the hours,  
Each moment folding like uncreased paper.  

Each moment folding like uncreased paper,  
Blank spaces ache for ink I'll never find.  

Blank spaces ache for ink I'll never find,  
A silence hums where voices used to live.  

A silence hums where voices used to live,  
I sit in shadows while the rain taps glass.

subject: indoor activities
poem_text:
The board sat glowing beneath the kitchen lamp.  
Its corners curled, worn soft by eager hands.  

Its corners curled, worn soft by eager hands,  
Dice rolled like thunder, distant, but full of want.  

Dice rolled like thunder, distant, but full of want,  
Chased by laughter colliding with the walls.  

Chased by laughter colliding with the walls,  
We waited for turns like late-summer rain.  

We waited for turns like late-summer rain,  
The hours swayed, heavy as a vinyl hum.  

The hours swayed, heavy as a vinyl hum,  
Pieces moved—lives rebuilt, forever in flux.  

Pieces moved—lives rebuilt, forever in flux,  
The board sat glowing beneath the kitchen lamp.

subject: life choices
poem_text:
Each choice I make leaves echoes in my chest,  
A path unwalked still murmurs through my veins.  

A path unwalked still murmurs through my veins,  
Its whispers trace regret, sharp as a blade.  

Its whispers trace regret, sharp as a blade,  
Yet every turn has carved me where I stand.  

Yet every turn has carved me where I stand,  
Invisible maps etched deep within my palms.  

Invisible maps etched deep within my palms—  
The roads I missed still hum beneath my skin.  

The roads I missed still hum beneath my skin,  
Reminding me of doors I dared not face.  

Reminding me of doors I dared not face,  
Each choice I make leaves echoes in my chest.

subject: life choices
poem_text:
The path I chose was narrow, dark with bends.  
Each shadow whispered secrets of an end.  

Each shadow whispered secrets of an end.  
I stumbled forward, called it faith, my friend.  

I stumbled forward, called it faith, my friend,  
Though doubt was heavy, harder to defend.  

Though doubt was heavy, harder to defend,  
I craved the light that waited past the bend.  

I craved the light that waited past the bend,  
But feared my stride might break, or never mend.  

But feared my stride might break, or never mend,  
I stumbled still, pretending strength won’t bend.  

I stumbled still, pretending strength won’t bend.  
The path I chose was narrow, dark with bends.

subject: life choices
poem_text:
The road split where the sycamores bent low,  
Two paths whispered beneath the dying light.  

Two paths whispered beneath the dying light,  
One bore the scent of rain, the other of dust.  

One bore the scent of rain, the other of dust—  
Both promised softness, but only one felt true.  

Both promised softness, but only one felt true,  
The gravel hummed, a song my heels once knew.  

The gravel hummed, a song my heels once knew,  
It sang of risk, of ache, of running blind.  

It sang of risk, of ache, of running blind,  
The other path stood mute, though lined in gold.  

The other path stood mute, though lined in gold,  
I lingered there, unsure which pain to love.  

The road split where the sycamores bent low.

subject: lgbtq+
poem_text:
I built my truth, a house against the storm.  
A storm that came with silence, sharp as knives.  

A storm that came with silence, sharp as knives,  
But I held my voice as the thunder rose.  

I held my voice as the thunder rose,  
Fearing the echoes buried me alive.  

Fearing the echoes buried me alive,  
I learned to live where closets steal the light.  

I learned to live where closets steal the light,  
But found the sun in whispers safe and warm.  

I found the sun in whispers safe and warm—  
Love grows despite the fists that hold it down.  

Love grows despite the fists that hold it down.  
I built my truth, a house against the storm.

subject: lgbtq+
poem_text:
I stand between the shadow and the light.  
The world pretends it cannot see the glow.  

The world pretends it cannot see the glow—  
A fire burns where silence used to grow.  

A fire burns where silence used to grow,  
Its heat a hymn, its ash a buried name.  

Its heat a hymn, its ash a buried name—  
Each spark a story, whispered into flame.  

Each spark a story, whispered into flame,  
The voice that rises never sounds the same.  

The voice that rises never sounds the same  
But still it sings, unbroken by the shame.  

But still it sings, unbroken by the shame,  
I stand between the shadow and the light.

subject: lgbtq+
poem_text:
A rainbow shimmered on the cracked asphalt,  
Its colors blurred by last night’s heavy rain.  

Its colors blurred by last night’s heavy rain—  
A fleeting flag beneath the city’s weight.  

A fleeting flag beneath the city’s weight,  
It carried every name we’d whispered quiet.  

It carried every name we’d whispered quiet,  
The kinds of love we’d learned to keep in shadows.  

The kinds of love we’d learned to keep in shadows  
Gleamed bold when sunlight broke the smoky sky.  

Gleamed bold when sunlight broke the smoky sky,  
But faded fast as footsteps crossed its span.  

But faded fast as footsteps crossed its span—  
A truth we knew but pretended would still linger.  

A rainbow shimmered on the cracked asphalt.

subject: living
poem_text:
To live is to carry the weight of the day,  
This weight is softer than it first appears.  

This weight is softer than it first appears,  
A stone becomes silk in the hands of time.  

A stone becomes silk in the hands of time,  
Yet hours still carve rivers into your face.  

Yet hours still carve rivers into your face,  
The body holds its grief like hidden wine.  

The body holds its grief like hidden wine,  
Each sip reveals the sharpness of the sweet.  

Each sip reveals the sharpness of the sweet,  
The joy you taste will cut you when you breathe.  

The joy you taste will cut you when you breathe,  
And yet, we crave the weight of every day.  

To live is to carry the weight of the day.

subject: living
poem_text:
The sky is heavy, bruised beneath its light.  
A weight I carry, though it hides from sight.  

A weight I carry, though it hides from sight,  
Becomes the silence pressing through the night.  

Becomes the silence pressing through the night—  
A voice that never speaks but knows it’s right.  

A voice that never speaks but knows it’s right,  
For every shadow lengthens in its flight.  

For every shadow lengthens in its flight,  
And still, the ground swallows the edge of might.  

And still, the ground swallows the edge of might,  
Where roots refuse to rise against their blight.  

Where roots refuse to rise against their blight,  
The sky is heavy, bruised beneath its light.

subject: living
poem_text:
The rain begins, a hush that softens the day.  
A whisper like the comfort of quiet hands.  

A whisper like the comfort of quiet hands,  
It taps the glass, a rhythm bound to calm.  

It taps the glass, a rhythm bound to calm,  
Though shadows stretch long across the room.  

Though shadows stretch long across the room,  
The warmth of breath clouds the chill of the pane.  

The warmth of breath clouds the chill of the pane,  
Drawing faint shapes that vanish with time.  

Drawing faint shapes that vanish with time,  
The rain persists, steady, resolute, slow.  

The rain persists, steady, resolute, slow—  
The sound of it fills the space love once held.  

The sound of it fills the space love once held,  
The rain begins, a hush that softens the day.

subject: love
poem_text:
I hold her name like water in my hands.  
The weight of love, it slips through brittle palms.  

The weight of love, it slips through brittle palms—  
A flood that drowns but also keeps me whole.  

A flood that drowns but also keeps me whole,  
Its tide runs deeper than my walled-off heart.  

Its tide runs deeper than my walled-off heart;  
I dream of safety, holding her in storms.  

I dream of safety, holding her in storms,  
Yet fear the wreckage soft devotion brings.  

Yet fear the wreckage soft devotion brings,  
And know her voice rebuilds what love undoes.  

I hold her name like water in my hands.

subject: love
poem_text:
The heart learns stillness from an empty room,  
A hush where echoes swell and crawl like vines.  

A hush where echoes swell and crawl like vines,  
I trace their paths to find what they entwine.  

I trace their paths to find what they entwine,  
A door left open, ghosts sip at the air.  

A door left open, ghosts sip at the air,  
Their whispers tangle threads I cannot bear.  

Their whispers tangle threads I cannot bear,  
Each knot a story spun from frailest thread.  

Each knot a story spun from frailest thread,  
Its weight enough to rouse the quiet dead.  

Its weight enough to rouse the quiet dead—  
The heart learns stillness from an empty room.

subject: love
poem_text:
The letters we wrote turned to ash in the wind.  
Smoke ribboned upward, twisting like old regret.  

Smoke ribboned upward, twisting like old regret,  
Every word unspoken caught fire that night.  

Every word unspoken caught fire that night—  
What could not be said began to haunt the air.  

What could not be said began to haunt the air;  
Flames flickered where truth once whispered your name.  

Flames flickered where truth once whispered your name,  
Paper folded sharp as the edge of goodbye.  

Paper folded sharp as the edge of goodbye,  
Each flame a syllable spelling out our grief.  

Each flame a syllable spelling out our grief—  
The letters we wrote turned to ash in the wind.

subject: love death avoidance
poem_text:
I dreamt your touch was the edge of a blade—  
The gentlest wounds don’t feel like wounds at all.  

The gentlest wounds don’t feel like wounds at all;  
A kiss can cut where skin pretends to heal.  

A kiss can cut where skin pretends to heal,  
Yet silence, sharper, keeps the heart undone.  

Yet silence, sharper, keeps the heart undone,  
I held my breath and mistook it for living.  

I held my breath and mistook it for living;  
What isn’t said makes ghosts of memory.  

What isn’t said makes ghosts of memory,  
And yet I waited, fearing the last goodbye.  

And yet I waited, fearing the last goodbye—  
I dreamt your touch was the edge of a blade.

subject: love death avoidance
poem_text:
The clock hands scrape their way through shadowed time,  
Each second splits the air like whispered crime.  

Each second splits the air like whispered crime—  
A silence turns to louder moons that chime.  

A silence turns to louder moons that chime,  
Each pulse unveiled beneath the skin’s thin grime.  

Each pulse unveiled beneath the skin’s thin grime—  
A fragile hymn that fights against decline.  

A fragile hymn that fights against decline,  
The body bends but swears it’s still divine.  

The body bends but swears it’s still divine,  
A vessel built to war the fading line.  

A vessel built to war the fading line,  
The clock hands scrape their way through shadowed time.

subject: love death avoidance
poem_text:
The air was thick with the weight of withheld rain.  
Inside, your hands tightened their grip on the glass.  

Inside, your hands tightened their grip on the glass,  
As if it might shatter like words left unsaid.  

As if it might shatter like words left unsaid,  
I glanced outside, where the sky was close to tears.  

I glanced outside, where the sky was close to tears,  
And heard the hum of thunder roll through the trees.  

I heard the hum of thunder roll through the trees,  
Its low murmur aching, like lines we forgot.  

Its low murmur aching, like lines we forgot,  
While your breath slowed—unsure, yet still breaking mine.  

While your breath slowed—unsure, yet still breaking mine,  
The rain refused to fall, just kept holding back.  

The air was thick with the weight of withheld rain.

subject: memory & nostalgia
poem_text:
The past arrives like smoke in a quiet room,  
It stains the air and turns everything gray.  

It stains the air and turns everything gray—  
A shadow that folds the light out of reach.  

A shadow that folds the light out of reach,  
Whisper-soft, it knows the shape of your voice.  

Whisper-soft, it knows the shape of your voice,  
A song half-sung, undone by its echoes.  

A song half-sung, undone by its echoes,  
I hear it now, though time has made it smaller.  

I hear it now, though time has made it smaller,  
The stars erasing themselves from the night.  

The stars erasing themselves from the night—  
The past arrives like smoke in a quiet room.

subject: memory & nostalgia
poem_text:
Where have all the voices gone that sang to me?  
They whispered like wind through sharp, amber light.  

They whispered like wind through sharp, amber light—  
An ache that curls soft but pulls me farther back.  

An ache that curls soft but pulls me farther back,  
To the hum of a house that no longer stands.  

The hum of a house that no longer stands,  
Its windows once glowed, tender as open hands.  

Its windows once glowed, tender as open hands,  
Framing faces that blurred through passing time.  

Framing faces that blurred through passing time,  
I call, but what echoes is silence, not sound.  

I call, but what echoes is silence, not sound.  
Where have all the voices gone that sang to me?

subject: memory & nostalgia
poem_text:
The scent of late August lingers in the air.  
Sweet grass wilts under the weight of sunlit haze.  

Sweet grass wilts under the weight of sunlit haze,  
Where we once sat, our knees brushing, the past alive.  

Where we once sat, our knees brushing, the past alive,  
Cicadas screamed songs that made silence feel too much.  

Cicadas screamed songs that made silence feel too much—  
In their rhythm, the edge of longing hummed sharp.  

In their rhythm, the edge of longing hummed sharp,  
A trace of you stitched into the air like thread.  

A trace of you stitched into the air like thread:  
A fragrance clings—it's memory, or it’s loss.  

A fragrance clings—it's memory, or it’s loss.  
The scent of late August lingers in the air.

subject: men & women
poem_text:
A man and a woman are storms in retreat,  
Their hearts collide, yet seek shelter in silence.  

Their hearts collide, yet seek shelter in silence,  
Echoes of words dissolve into cold rooms.  

Echoes of words dissolve into cold rooms,  
Each absence a wound they dare not expose.  

Each absence a wound they dare not expose,  
The mirror bears witness to fragile resolve.  

The mirror bears witness to fragile resolve,  
Reflections fracture where longing begins.  

Reflections fracture where longing begins,  
Bound by desire, yet torn by its chains.  

Bound by desire, yet torn by its chains,  
A man and a woman are storms in retreat.

subject: men & women
poem_text:
The fire said it would not burn us to the bone.  
Its heat, though soft, soon left us ash and smoke.  

Its heat, though soft, soon left us ash and smoke.  
What blooms in trust can break when hands provoke.  

What blooms in trust can break when hands provoke,  
Yet silence tempts me as it weaves the yoke.  

Yet silence tempts me as it weaves the yoke—  
Two shadows tangled, neither whole, both broke.  

Two shadows tangled, neither whole, both broke;  
The dance of mirrors hides what once was spoke.  

The dance of mirrors hides what once was spoke—  
A truth too jagged for the throat to cloak.  

A truth too jagged for the throat to cloak,  
The fire said it would not burn us to the bone.

subject: men & women
poem_text:
He left his glass on the windowsill at dusk.  
The amber light caught where his lips had been.  

The amber light caught where his lips had been,  
A trace of wanting pressed into the rim.  

A trace of wanting pressed into the rim,  
Her fingers lingered, circling the stain.  

Her fingers lingered, circling the stain,  
The silence hummed like something left unsaid.  

The silence hummed like something left unsaid,  
Both waiting till the air grew thick with ache.  

Both waiting till the air grew thick with ache—  
He stood, unmoving, and she held her breath.  

He stood, unmoving, and she held her breath.  
He left his glass on the windowsill at dusk.

subject: mythology & folklore
poem_text:
The gods still whisper beneath the breath of trees,  
Their stories seed shadows with words untold.  

Their stories seed shadows with words untold,  
A language born of fire, smoke, and ache.  

A language born of fire, smoke, and ache,  
Carries the weight of gods disguised as men.  

Carries the weight of gods disguised as men,  
Who walk among us, cloaked in fog and song.  

Who walk among us, cloaked in fog and song,  
Their laughter cracks the sky, their tears flood plains.  

Their laughter cracks the sky, their tears flood plains,  
While mortals pray in tongues carved into rock.  

While mortals pray in tongues carved into rock,  
The gods still whisper beneath the breath of trees.

subject: mythology & folklore
poem_text:
The woods speak softly of gods who once roamed free.  
Their voices linger faint within hollowed trees.  

Their voices linger faint within hollowed trees,  
A language carved in bark by hands now lost.  

A language carved in bark by hands now lost,  
Marks the price of being seen and holding power.  

Marks the price of being seen and holding power:  
How many stories live in a single name?  

How many stories live in a single name,  
Each syllable a refuge for those forgotten?  

Each syllable a refuge for those forgotten—  
What’s left of them now dwells in whispers, in dusk.  

What’s left of them now dwells in whispers, in dusk;  
The woods speak softly of gods who once roamed free.

subject: mythology & folklore
poem_text:
At dusk, the lantern flickers, caught in wind,  
Its glow bends where lost travelers begin.  

Its glow bends where lost travelers begin,  
A shadow dances—who will let it in?  

A shadow dances—who will let it in?  
The stories say it guards a buried sin.  

The stories say it guards a buried sin,  
A beast unseen but breathing from within.  

A beast unseen but breathing from within,  
It hums in tune with mournful violins.  

It hums in tune with mournful violins,  
The air is thick; the pact is sealed—no wins.  

The air is thick; the pact is sealed—no wins,  
At dusk, the lantern flickers, caught in wind.

subject: nature
poem_text:
The trees hum songs no one can truly hear.  
A low wind bends their voices into prayer.  

A low wind bends their voices into prayer,  
While roots grip earth like hands holding despair.  

While roots grip earth like hands holding despair,  
The soil remembers what we’ve left unclear.  

The soil remembers what we’ve left unclear—  
Each footprint marks the weight of fleeting care.  

Each footprint marks the weight of fleeting care,  
Yet rivers cleanse the sins we leave them bare.  

Yet rivers cleanse the sins we leave them bare,  
Their depths conceal what we cannot repair.  

Their depths conceal what we cannot repair.  
The trees hum songs no one can truly hear.

subject: nature
poem_text:
Beneath the trees, the earth is breathing slow.  
I feel its pulse beneath my tired feet.  

I feel its pulse beneath my tired feet,  
A rhythm older than the blood I know.  

A rhythm older than the blood I know,  
Whispering truths in languages of stone.  

Whispering truths in languages of stone,  
The river sings what roots have left unsaid.  

The river sings what roots have left unsaid,  
And carries shadows carved from fading storms.  

And carries shadows carved from fading storms,  
Their echoes soft against the face of time.  

Their echoes soft against the face of time,  
Beneath the trees, the earth is breathing slow.

subject: nature
poem_text:
The river’s edge runs soft beneath my feet,  
It hums like strings pulled tight in aching air.  

It hums like strings pulled tight in aching air,  
Its voice both comfort and a quiet sting.  

Its voice both comfort and a quiet sting,  
I see my shadow drawn long on the bank.  

I see my shadow drawn long on the bank,  
The water mirrors all I’ll never say.  

The water mirrors all I’ll never say,  
A glint of silver fish fades out of sight.  

A glint of silver fish fades out of sight,  
Their leaving stretches time into a thread.  

Their leaving stretches time into a thread—  
The river’s edge runs soft beneath my feet.

subject: power
poem_text:
The weight of power bends the will inside,  
Its heft a shadow cast too vast to bear.  

Its heft a shadow, cast too vast to bear,  
Looming like storms that blacken morning air.  

Looming like storms that blacken morning air,  
It cracks the fragile silence of despair.  

It cracks the fragile silence of despair,  
Each choice a knife that carves the mind unfair.  

Each choice a knife that carves the mind unfair,  
Slicing the joy from those who wouldn’t dare.  

Slicing the joy from those who wouldn’t dare,  
Power is stolen, not a gift to share.  

Power is stolen, not a gift to share,  
The weight of power bends the will inside.

subject: power
poem_text:
The heavy crown leans sharp against my brow.  
Its weight suggests a life I didn’t choose.  

Its weight suggests a life I didn’t choose,  
Yet here I stand, the bearer of all eyes.  

Yet here I stand, the bearer of all eyes,  
A shadow cast against the day’s thin light.  

A shadow cast against the day’s thin light—  
Their want of me, a fire that burns too close.  

Their want of me, a fire that burns too close,  
So I’ve learned to keep my voice a steady stone.  

I’ve learned to keep my voice a steady stone,  
Yet stones can break when touched the wrong way twice.  

Yet stones can break when touched the wrong way twice,  
And still the crown remains, though I might fall.  

The heavy crown leans sharp against my brow.

subject: power
poem_text:
The dam was trembling beneath the weight of rain,  
Its voice a low growl, a warning we ignored.  

Its voice a low growl, a warning we ignored—  
Such silence breaks when rivers meet the storm.  

Such silence breaks when rivers meet the storm,  
Steel and stone can't hold what wants to be free.  

Steel and stone can't hold what wants to be free;  
Water fought wild against the cage we built.  

Water fought wild against the cage we built,  
Rushing to erase the hands that pressed it down.  

Rushing to erase the hands that pressed it down,  
It swallowed roads, roared past the trembling shore.  

It swallowed roads, roared past the trembling shore—  
The dam was trembling beneath the weight of rain.

subject: poetry & poets
poem_text:
We craft our lines to live when we are dust.  
Each word a fracture, trembling yet robust.  

Each word a fracture, trembling yet robust,  
A breath held forth, then fading as it must.  

A breath held forth, then fading as it must,  
Still yearning, shape of hunger turned to trust.  

Still yearning, shape of hunger turned to trust,  
To say the unsaid, voice the voiceless husk.  

To say the unsaid, voice the voiceless husk,  
We braid our grief in rhythms we adjust.  

We braid our grief in rhythms we adjust,  
And sew a world from shadows we entrust.  

And sew a world from shadows we entrust,  
We craft our lines to live when we are dust.

subject: poetry & poets
poem_text:
The page resists the touch; it stays so still,  
Its silence hums like something yet unsaid.  

Its silence hums like something yet unsaid,  
A chord half-struck, a note that bends then breaks.  

A chord half-struck, a note that bends then breaks,  
The hand aches, grasping shadows for the shape.  

The hand aches, grasping shadows for the shape—  
To fold a world, one must unravel air.  

To fold a world, one must unravel air,  
Each breath a thread pulled tight, each pause a risk.  

Each breath a thread pulled tight, each pause a risk—  
What’s left undone becomes the work’s true weight.  

What’s left undone becomes the work’s true weight;  
The page resists the touch, it stays so still.

subject: poetry & poets
poem_text:
I watched the lantern burn a hole in the night.  
The dark, it folded, swallowed the weak flame whole.  

The dark, it folded, swallowed the weak flame whole.  
A page of verse dissolved beneath its glow.  

A page of verse dissolved beneath its glow—  
What use is a poem if it can’t warm the hands?  

What use is a poem if it can’t warm the hands,  
Or mend the silence that settles like damp ash?  

Or mend the silence that settles like damp ash,  
When words fail, what rises? Smoke, or a prayer?  

When words fail, what rises? Smoke, or a prayer?  
I strained for meaning, but found only the wind.  

I strained for meaning, but found only the wind.  
I watched the lantern burn a hole in the night.

subject: race & ethnicity
poem_text:
The past is carved into the skin we wear,  
A map of stories etched beneath the bone.  

A map of stories etched beneath the bone,  
Each mark a hymn of silence torn in two.  

Each mark a hymn of silence torn in two,  
We carry loss like rivers hold their banks.  

We carry loss like rivers hold their banks,  
The body bends but never breaks its chains.  

The body bends but never breaks its chains,  
An echo lives where voices once were whole.  

An echo lives where voices once were whole,  
What’s buried deep can still refuse to die.  

What’s buried deep can still refuse to die—  
The past is carved into the skin we wear.

subject: race & ethnicity
poem_text:
I carry the names my ancestors have lost,  
Their shadows trail behind me through every room.  

Their shadows trail behind me through every room,  
A hum I’ve learned to quiet but never tune.  

A hum I’ve learned to quiet but never tune,  
Still, it clings like smoke to the edges of sound.  

Still, it clings like smoke to the edges of sound,  
Each word I speak curves back, echoing old wounds.  

Each word I speak curves back, echoing old wounds,  
A language burned but rebuilt in muted hues.  

A language burned but rebuilt in muted hues,  
My tongue a map they tried to blur but could not.  

My tongue a map they tried to blur but could not,  
I carry the names my ancestors have lost.

subject: race & ethnicity
poem_text:
I was the shadow in the corner of the frame.  
The light bent differently when it kissed my skin.  

The light bent differently when it kissed my skin,  
Marking me other, though the smile stayed wide.  

Marking me other, though the smile stayed wide—  
Their arms draped close, but never quite around me.  

Their arms draped close, but never quite around me,  
Like borderlines you learn to trace but not cross.  

Like borderlines you learn to trace but not cross,  
The camera clicked and still the gap remained.  

The camera clicked and still the gap remained,  
A silence louder than the laughter that brewed.  

A silence louder than the laughter that brewed.  
I was the shadow in the corner of the frame.

subject: relationships
poem_text:
I dream in fractures—love splits like breaking glass.  
The softest touch can cut a tender palm.  

The softest touch can cut a tender palm.  
We hold too tightly, mistaking grip for grace.  

We hold too tightly, mistaking grip for grace.  
A tangled knot can choke what once was bloom.  

A tangled knot can choke what once was bloom.  
Your warmth, now fire, consumes what it once fed.  

Your warmth, now fire, consumes what it once fed.  
We build a home, then torch it for the glow.  

We build a home, then torch it for the glow.  
Our shadows stretch but never truly meet.  

Our shadows stretch but never truly meet.  
I dream in fractures—love splits like breaking glass.

subject: relationships
poem_text:
I turned toward silence when the words grew sharp.  
Each breath I swallowed carried weight unknown.  

Each breath I swallowed carried weight unknown,  
An ache that bloomed where tenderness had burned.  

An ache that bloomed where tenderness had burned,  
A garden wild with thorns instead of fruit.  

A garden wild with thorns instead of fruit—  
We built it, though the soil refused our seeds.  

We built it, though the soil refused our seeds;  
Something in us loved the futile labor.  

Something in us loved the futile labor,  
The way we wrestled with what wouldn’t yield.  

The way we wrestled with what wouldn’t yield,  
I turned toward silence when the words grew sharp.

subject: relationships
poem_text:
The last lamp left on glows dim against the dark.  
Its golden light hums like a whisper you've lost.  

Its golden light hums like a whisper you've lost,  
A soundless plea folded into a tired room.  

A soundless plea folded into a tired room,  
This space still breathing the fights we never finished.  

This space still breathing the fights we never finished,  
Walls echo with silences too heavy to hold.    

Walls echo with silences too heavy to hold,  
We sat, unmoving, the air thick with pause.  

We sat, unmoving, the air thick with pause,  
Your shadow blurred by the faint lamp’s tired flicker.  

Your shadow blurred by the faint lamp’s tired flicker,  
The last lamp left on glows dim against the dark.

subject: romantic love
poem_text:
I held your hand as the evening fell too fast.  
The weight of twilight pressed against my chest.  

The weight of twilight pressed against my chest—  
Your silence spoke a truth I dared not ask.  

Your silence spoke a truth I dared not ask.  
Its echo lingered—pain, a muted thread.  

Its echo lingered—pain, a muted thread,  
Where longing frayed the moments I had grasped.  

Where longing frayed the moments I had grasped,  
Each touch unraveled into quiet dread.  

Each touch unraveled into quiet dread,  
Yet still, my heart held on, refused to rest.  

Yet still, my heart held on, refused to rest.  
I held your hand as the evening fell too fast.

subject: romantic love
poem_text:
I touched the edges of what I thought was mine.  
The heart bends strange beneath a borrowed light.  

The heart bends strange beneath a borrowed light.  
It beats for shadows, learning hunger’s shape.  

It beats for shadows, learning hunger’s shape.  
A hollow tune where promises once sang.  

A hollow tune where promises once sang—  
The echoes linger, tangled in my chest.  

The echoes linger, tangled in my chest,  
Each breath a tether to what never stayed.  

Each breath a tether to what never stayed—  
I whispered prayers to hold what let me go.  

I whispered prayers to hold what let me go.  
I touched the edges of what I thought was mine.

subject: romantic love
poem_text:
The rain fell soft, a hymn upon our skin.  
Each drop a voice that pulled us closer still.  

Each drop a voice that pulled us closer still,  
A quiet rhythm bending time to will.  

A quiet rhythm bending time to will—  
Your lips met mine and taught the world to pause.  

Your lips met mine and taught the world to pause,  
As thunder hummed and cracked the evening’s jaws.  

As thunder hummed and cracked the evening’s jaws,  
The sky spilled silver over shadowed streets.  

The sky spilled silver over shadowed streets,  
And in that glow, your touch made me complete.  

And in that glow, your touch made me complete,  
The rain fell soft, a hymn upon our skin.

subject: violence
poem_text:
The knife that shines does not reveal its sting.  
It rests in shadow, whispering of flames.  

It rests in shadow, whispering of flames,  
A quiet hymn that sears the hollow night.  

A quiet hymn that sears the hollow night—  
It hums both rage and longing through the air.  

It hums both rage and longing through the air;  
A hand can wield it, trembling, still precise.  

A hand can wield it, trembling, still precise—  
Steel doesn’t shiver though it meets our flesh.  

Steel doesn’t shiver though it meets our flesh,  
But bodies fold where silence strikes its chord.  

But bodies fold where silence strikes its chord,  
And scars become the echoes of its song.  

The knife that shines does not reveal its sting.

subject: violence
poem_text:
The sound of wood splintering wakes me at night.  
A crack through the air feels sharper than dreams.  

A crack through the air feels sharper than dreams—  
The walls hold their breath, bracing for their doom.  

The walls hold their breath, bracing for their doom,  
And silence hums loud when the storm is the room.  

And silence hums loud when the storm is the room,  
Where shadows shift into things they shouldn’t be.  

Where shadows shift into things they shouldn’t be,  
A hand moves to fix what it breaks every time.  

A hand moves to fix what it breaks every time,  
Each gesture so close to pardon, but not quite.  

Each gesture so close to pardon, but not quite—  
The sound of wood splintering wakes me at night.

subject: violence
poem_text:
The bottle shattered, its shards kissed the floor.  
A broken thing reflects us in sharp light.  

A broken thing reflects us in sharp light,  
Splitting the silence into jagged screams.  

Splitting the silence into jagged screams,  
We wade through glass turned river underfoot.  

We wade through glass turned river underfoot,  
Each step remembering what flames once burned.  

Each step remembering what flames once burned,  
Your hand a fist that broke before it rose.  

Your hand a fist that broke before it rose,  
And I a wall that learned to stand too still.  

And I a wall that learned to stand too still—  
The bottle shattered, its shards kissed the floor.

subject: sorrow & grieving
poem_text:
The weight of sorrow is a shadow’s climb.  
At dusk, it lingers, clinging to bare walls.  

At dusk, it lingers, clinging to bare walls,  
A silence stretching wide where voices were.  

A silence stretching wide where voices were—  
The echoes fold and curl like burdened wings.  

The echoes fold and curl like burdened wings;  
Grief whispers low, its language thick with ash.  

Grief whispers low, its language thick with ash,  
A flame burned out but smoldering inside.  

A flame burned out but smoldering inside—  
Each tear bears heat but cools before it falls.  

Each tear bears heat but cools before it falls;  
The weight of sorrow is a shadow’s climb.

subject: sorrow & grieving
poem_text:
The moon hangs heavy, caught in a net of trees.  
Its glow spills like tears on the darkened ground.  

Its glow spills like tears on the darkened ground.  
Shadows bend where the heart forgets its weight.  

Shadows bend where the heart forgets its weight.  
Each crack in the night feels sharp as a blade.  

Each crack in the night feels sharp as a blade,  
Splitting the hush where whispers used to live.  

Splitting the hush where whispers used to live,  
Silence blooms wide, filling what should remain.  

Silence blooms wide, filling what should remain—  
The echoes of names too tender to hold.  

The echoes of names too tender to hold,  
The moon hangs heavy, caught in a net of trees.

subject: sorrow & grieving
poem_text:
The empty chair still faces the window's light.  
It leans to listen for footsteps that won't come.  

It leans to listen for footsteps that won't come,  
The wood softens where you once shifted your weight.  

The wood softens where you once shifted your weight,  
Cracked by the pressure of time's aching fingers.  

Cracked by the pressure of time's aching fingers,  
Its arms curve as if they still cradle your hands.  

Its arms curve as if they still cradle your hands,  
The varnish worn thin where grief smooths memory.  

The varnish worn thin where grief smooths memory,  
How silence keeps the room heavy, still breathing.  

How silence keeps the room heavy, still breathing—  
The empty chair still faces the window's light.

subject: social commentaries
poem_text:
The mirror is cracked, but it still reflects light.  
Its shards cut deeper, sharp truths ignite pain.  

Its shards cut deeper, sharp truths ignite pain.  
Voices rise as wounds sing with righteous fire.  

Voices rise as wounds sing with righteous fire.  
A hymn laced with grief; progress climbs through ash.  

A hymn laced with grief; progress climbs through ash,  
Yet silence stalks beside the songs we mourn.  

Yet silence stalks beside the songs we mourn—  
A shadowed weight pressed down by unseen hands.  

A shadowed weight pressed down by unseen hands  
Wrests freedom’s breath, still chains hum beneath skin.  

Wrests freedom’s breath, still chains hum beneath skin.  
The mirror is cracked, but it still reflects light.

subject: social commentaries
poem_text:
The silence between us grows sharp as a blade.  
A question hangs heavy—who taught you this fight?  

A question hangs heavy—who taught you this fight?  
Your voice is the echo of someone else’s scream.  

Your voice is the echo of someone else’s scream,  
Yet you wear it like armor, cold and well-forged.  

Yet you wear it like armor, cold and well-forged,  
Believing each wound makes you stronger than truth.  

Believing each wound makes you stronger than truth,  
You turn toward the shouting, and call it your home.  

You turn toward the shouting, and call it your home—  
A chorus of fury that drowns out the stars.  

A chorus of fury that drowns out the stars,  
The silence between us grows sharp as a blade.

subject: social commentaries
poem_text:
I see myself reflected in the cracked phone screen.  
This fractured face is more than glass can bear.  

This fractured face is more than glass can bear—  
Each stare repeats a judgment I don’t control.  

Each stare repeats a judgment I don’t control,  
The bus stop crowd shifts, restless, marking time.  

The bus stop crowd shifts, restless, marking time,  
Their worlds refracted, splintered into grids.  

Their worlds refracted, splintered into grids—  
The newsfeed scrolls like gospel, truth in shards.  

The newsfeed scrolls like gospel, truth in shards,  
And we’re all prophets locked outside the story.  

We’re all prophets locked outside the story;  
I see myself reflected in the cracked phone screen.

subject: subjugation
poem_text:
The weight of silence shapes the spine, it bends.  
A crooked frame conceals what it defends.  

A crooked frame conceals what it defends,  
Breaking under truths we cannot amend.  

Breaking under truths we cannot amend,  
The tongue is chained, it chokes what words intend.  

The tongue is chained, it chokes what words intend,  
Speech buried deep becomes the heart’s despondent end.  

Speech buried deep becomes the heart’s despondent end,  
Yet breath still rises, though it can’t transcend.  

Yet breath still rises, though it can’t transcend,  
A life held captive learns how to pretend.  

A life held captive learns how to pretend—  
The weight of silence shapes the spine, it bends.

subject: subjugation
poem_text:
The weight of chains does not dissolve with time.  
Each link hums songs I never learned to sing.  

Each link hums songs I never learned to sing,  
A rhythm forged in silence, sharp and bound.  

A rhythm forged in silence, sharp and bound,  
The echo grips like ghosts pressed to my skin.  

The echo grips like ghosts pressed to my skin,  
It pulls the breath from wounds I thought had healed.  

It pulls the breath from wounds I thought had healed,  
Old scars ignite like fire beneath the ash.  

Old scars ignite like fire beneath the ash,  
What lingers refuses both name and escape.  

What lingers refuses both name and escape—  
The weight of chains does not dissolve with time.

subject: subjugation
poem_text:
The weight of the chain pressed deep into my skin.  
Its gleaming links wrapped tight, a lesson in grief.  

Its gleaming links wrapped tight, a lesson in grief—  
The iron bit down where the flesh once believed.  

The iron bit down where the flesh once believed,  
Each mark a map of someone else’s command.  

Each mark a map of someone else’s command,  
The sky above burned red as though it, too, bowed.  

The sky above burned red as though it, too, bowed,  
An ache of silence where wind should dare to move.  

An ache of silence where wind should dare to move—  
How does one breathe when even air turns to stone?  

How does one breathe when even air turns to stone?  
The weight of the chain pressed deep into my skin.

subject: the mind
poem_text:
The mind is a storm no anchor can tether.  
Its chaos whispers soft like a lover's breath.  

Its chaos whispers soft like a lover's breath,  
Until it swells to drown the quiet in me.  

Until it swells to drown the quiet in me,  
Each thought repeats, then folds into another.  

Each thought repeats, then folds into another,  
Unraveling threads I once thought were bound tight.  

Unraveling threads I once thought were bound tight,  
I chase the echoes of dreams I can’t remember.  

I chase the echoes of dreams I can’t remember,  
Building mazes of memory in the dark.  

Building mazes of memory in the dark,  
The mind is a storm no anchor can tether.

subject: the mind
poem_text:
I wake to the hum of thoughts that never rest.  
A song too loud to hush keeps me awake.  

A song too loud to hush keeps me awake,  
Each note a chord struck deep within the chest.  

Each note a chord struck deep within the chest,  
Pressing like a hand that won’t release its grip.  

Pressing like a hand that won’t release its grip,  
The weight of what I’ve lost, what I could lose.  

The weight of what I’ve lost, what I could lose  
Bleeds into silence, shadows creeping close.  

Bleeds into silence, shadows creeping close,  
An endless tide I can neither fight nor flee.  

An endless tide I can neither fight nor flee—  
I wake to the hum of thoughts that never rest.

subject: the mind
poem_text:
The snow collects like thoughts that come too late—  
Each flake, a silence folded into gray.  

Each flake, a silence folded into gray,  
I watch the cold erase where footsteps fell.  

I watch the cold erase where footsteps fell,  
And wonder where the warmth in me has gone.  

And wonder where the warmth in me has gone,  
The trees stand bare, their arms too wide to hold.  

The trees stand bare, their arms too wide to hold,  
Their shadows sprawl like dreams I can't recall.  

Their shadows sprawl like dreams I can't recall,  
The sun retreats, a whisper to the snow.  

The sun retreats, a whisper to the snow—  
The snow collects like thoughts that come too late.

subject: trees and flowers
poem_text:
In the shadows, roots stretch for streams unseen,  
Their thirst, a hunger deeper than green leaves.  

Their thirst, a hunger deeper than green leaves,  
Branches sway as whispers drift in the breeze.  

Branches sway as whispers drift in the breeze,  
Each bloom a promise the earth dares to keep.  

Each bloom a promise the earth dares to keep,  
Falling petals weave stories while we sleep.  

Falling petals weave stories while we sleep,  
Soft decay feeds the soil we fail to see.  

Soft decay feeds the soil we fail to see,  
Life’s pulse persists beneath what seems to cease.  

Life’s pulse persists beneath what seems to cease,  
In the shadows, roots stretch for streams unseen.

subject: trees and flowers
poem_text:
The place I love is carved from loss and green,  
A quiet shadow where my heart has been.  

A quiet shadow where my heart has been,  
Its edges bend where whispers once were thin.  

Its edges bend where whispers once were thin,  
A patient keeper of the world within.  

A patient keeper of the world within,  
Its breath is soft, though time is thick with sin.  

Its breath is soft, though time is thick with sin,  
Still roots take hold where new life must begin.  

Still roots take hold where new life must begin,  
Each tender reach defies the earth’s still spin.  

Each tender reach defies the earth's still spin—  
The place I love is carved from loss and green.

subject: trees and flowers
poem_text:
Beneath the sycamore, the shade grew wide,  
A place where fractured sunlight dared to bloom.  

A place where fractured sunlight dared to bloom,  
The tulips blushed in shadows strewn like silk.  

The tulips blushed in shadows strewn like silk,  
Each petal trembling, burdened by the breeze.  

Each petal trembling, burdened by the breeze,  
The tree stood watchful, ancient in its stillness.  

The tree stood watchful, ancient in its stillness,  
Its roots, deep veins that drank the earth's own pulse.  

Its roots, deep veins that drank the earth's own pulse,  
Once touched my palm like whispers from the soil.  

Once touched my palm like whispers from the soil,  
I swore the flowers hummed their fleeting joy.  

Beneath the sycamore, the shade grew wide.

subject: truth
poem_text:
