The weight of truth is heavy in my hands.  
I did not expect it to feel so sharp.  

I did not expect it to feel so sharp,  
A blade I thought was dull but cuts so clean.  

A blade I thought was dull but cuts so clean,  
It carves my lies and leaves no place to hide.  

It carves my lies and leaves no place to hide,  
The mirror turns and shows what’s left of me.  

The mirror turns and shows what’s left of me—  
A stranger’s face that wears my voice like skin.  

A stranger’s face that wears my voice like skin,  
I call for answers, but the echo fades.  

I call for answers, but the echo fades.  
The weight of truth is heavy in my hands.

subject: truth
poem_text:
The lie I told grew wings and learned to soar.  
It cast a shadow I could not ignore.  

It cast a shadow I could not ignore,  
A hollow echo through a locked-back door.  

A hollow echo through a locked-back door.  
The sound of whispers craving something more.  

The sound of whispers craving something more,  
They spiral secrets I refuse to store.  

They spiral secrets I refuse to store,  
Each one erodes what once felt just and sure.  

Each one erodes what once felt just and sure,  
A quiet crack, a tremor in the floor.  

A quiet crack, a tremor in the floor,  
The lie I told grew wings and learned to soar.

subject: truth
poem_text:
I found your letter folded against the oak grain.  
The words clung soft, like whispers after rain.  

The words clung soft, like whispers after rain.  
Each line, a bruise I hadn’t dared to name.  

Each line, a bruise I hadn’t dared to name,  
Written in ink that bloomed like hidden shame.  

Written in ink that bloomed like hidden shame,  
Your hand pressed truths I couldn’t bear the same.  

Your hand pressed truths I couldn’t bear the same,  
Tracing regret through dust and fleeting flame.  

Tracing regret through dust and fleeting flame—  
Your voice still burns, though silence stakes its claim.  

Your voice still burns, though silence stakes its claim.  
I found your letter folded against the oak grain.

subject: twilight
poem_text:
The sky bruises violet, soft and unsure,  
A muted hymn that quiets the rushing world.  

A muted hymn that quiets the rushing world—  
Its silence lingers where no answers are found.  

Its silence lingers where no answers are found,  
Between the glow of dusk and coming of dark.  

Between the glow of dusk and coming of dark,  
Shadows stretch long, and time forgets its pace.  

Shadows stretch long, and time forgets its pace—  
A fragile stillness hums beneath the stars.  

A fragile stillness hums beneath the stars,  
While hearts weigh memories against the night’s pull.  

While hearts weigh memories against the night’s pull,  
The sky bruises violet, soft and unsure.

subject: twilight
poem_text:
At day's edge, the sky blushes like a fading wound.  
Its colors bruise where light and darkness collide.  

Its colors bruise where light and darkness collide,  
An ache that deepens as the shadows unfold.  

An ache that deepens as the shadows unfold,  
The quiet hum of night begins to take hold.  

The quiet hum of night begins to take hold,  
Whispers linger where day’s voice used to reside.  

Whispers linger where day’s voice used to reside,  
Every breath feels borrowed, caught between two worlds.  

Every breath feels borrowed, caught between two worlds,  
Endings stretch long, yet slip through fingers like smoke.  

Endings stretch long, yet slip through fingers like smoke—  
At day's edge, the sky blushes like a fading wound.

subject: twilight
poem_text:
The lake held twilight, a mirror turned to flame.  
Its surface burned though the night refused to fall.  

Its surface burned though the night refused to fall,  
Darkness trembling like breath smudged on the glass.  

Darkness trembling like breath smudged on the glass,  
The day exhaled, its edges breaking apart.  

The day exhaled, its edges breaking apart,  
Leaves caught the wind’s hymn, soft as time slipping.  

Leaves caught the wind’s hymn, soft as time slipping,  
Our shadows stretched low, bending toward silence.  

Our shadows stretched low, bending toward silence,  
How still we became, our faces kissed by dusk.  

How still we became, our faces kissed by dusk—  
The lake held twilight, a mirror turned to flame.

subject: urban environment
poem_text:
The city hums, a beast that never sleeps,  
Its growl a hymn to lives stacked wall on wall.  

Its growl a hymn to lives stacked wall on wall,  
Windows blink like eyes—watching, yet unseen.  

Windows blink like eyes—watching, yet unseen,  
The streets exhale, a breath of spilled desire.  

The streets exhale, a breath of spilled desire,  
Trash talk dances where the trains scream underground.  

Trash talk dances where the trains scream underground,  
Graffiti prayers bloom on concrete temples.  

Graffiti prayers bloom on concrete temples,  
Each scrawl a language made of wounds and truths.  

Each scrawl a language made of wounds and truths;  
The city hums, a beast that never sleeps.

subject: urban environment
poem_text:
City lights blur where the night feels too near.  
The hum of streets whispers love turned to rust.  

The hum of streets whispers love turned to rust,  
A song of metal against fleeting skies.  

A song of metal against fleeting skies,  
Windows reflect the days we’ve left behind.  

Windows reflect the days we’ve left behind,  
Steel skeletons cradle what we call home.  

Steel skeletons cradle what we call home,  
But shadows stretch long where softness once grew.  

But shadows stretch long where softness once grew,  
The alleys breathe loneliness like old smoke.  

The alleys breathe loneliness like old smoke.  
City lights blur where the night feels too near.

subject: urban environment
poem_text:
Heat clings to concrete, the city's breath is sour.  
The brick walls exhale smoke, a restless power.  

The brick walls exhale smoke, a restless power.  
Graffiti whispers names we’ve tried to forget.  

Graffiti whispers names we’ve tried to forget,  
Their colors bleeding into dusk’s hazy light.  

Their colors bleeding into dusk’s hazy light,  
Like broken glass sparkling underfoot.  

Like broken glass sparkling underfoot,  
The sidewalk remembers every small mistake.  

The sidewalk remembers every small mistake—  
Chewing gum and cigarettes, crushed into seams.  

Chewing gum and cigarettes, crushed into seams,  
Each crack in the pavement tells quiet stories.  

Each crack in the pavement tells quiet stories:  
Heat clings to concrete, the city's breath is sour.

subject: war & conflict
poem_text:
The cannons speak in tongues the earth remembers.  
Their words settle like ash in mothers' mouths.  

Their words settle like ash in mothers' mouths,  
A taste of grief that swallows every dawn.  

A taste of grief that swallows every dawn,  
The sky bruised purple by the weight of fire.  

The sky bruised purple by the weight of fire,  
Smoke blooms where flowers once pledged their return.  

Smoke blooms where flowers once pledged their return,  
Each promise buried deep beneath the soil.  

Each promise buried deep beneath the soil,  
The earth gives back lament shaped like a son.  

The earth gives back lament shaped like a son—  
The cannons speak in tongues the earth remembers.

subject: war & conflict
poem_text:
The streets grew quiet beneath a heavy gray—  
A silence louder than the guns had been.  

A silence louder than the guns had been,  
It settled in the cracks where voices broke.  

It settled in the cracks where voices broke,  
The air still reeked of things we couldn’t name.  

The air still reeked of things we couldn’t name,  
We learned to hush our grief beneath the ash.  

We learned to hush our grief beneath the ash,  
Each breath of loss tasted of something old.  

Each breath of loss tasted of something old,  
And yet we swallowed it, because we must.  

And yet we swallowed it, because we must—  
The streets grew quiet beneath a heavy gray.

subject: war & conflict
poem_text:
The mirror cracks while sunlight bends on the glass.  
This shimmer feels too much like something breaking—  

This shimmer feels too much like something breaking,  
A chorus of bombs hums through an open field.  

A chorus of bombs hums through an open field,  
Where shadows of men fall faster than their prayers.  

Where shadows of men fall faster than their prayers,  
The dirt remembers footprints and bloody hands.  

The dirt remembers footprints and bloody hands,  
Each grain bears a face, a name, a quiet scream.  

Each grain bears a face, a name, a quiet scream,  
Yet I still see my own in this shattered pane.  

Yet I still see my own in this shattered pane,  
The mirror cracks while sunlight bends on the glass.

subject: weather
poem_text:
The storm arrived and stole the sun from the sky.  
Gray clouds whispered secrets to a tired earth.  

Gray clouds whispered secrets to a tired earth,  
Their words a weight that bent the trees like grief.  

Their words a weight that bent the trees like grief,  
Each gust a hymn for things that once could stand.  

Each gust a hymn for things that once could stand,  
Rain traced old wounds against the window’s face.  

Rain traced old wounds against the window’s face,  
A mirror cracking under time’s sharp hand.  

A mirror cracking under time’s sharp hand,  
The storm recedes, but leaves its ghost behind.  

The storm recedes, but leaves its ghost behind—  
A haunting sky, where silence calls for light.  

The storm arrived and stole the sun from the sky.

subject: weather
poem_text:
The sky broke open, spilling its quiet rage.  
A silence so loud it could swallow the world.  

A silence so loud it could swallow the world,  
Soft as a scream that leaves no trace on the air.  

Soft as a scream that leaves no trace on the air,  
The ground beneath my feet trembled, unsteady.  

The ground beneath my feet trembled, unsteady,  
Each shadow stretching longer, darker, alive.  

Each shadow stretching longer, darker, alive—  
A mirror reflecting something I cannot name.  

A mirror reflecting something I cannot name,  
What shatters to pieces still holds the whole truth.  

What shatters to pieces still holds the whole truth:  
The sky broke open, spilling its quiet rage.

subject: weather
poem_text:
The storm slammed its fists on the porch at midnight.  
Its rage, a flood that sank the edges of thought.  

Its rage, a flood that sank the edges of thought,  
And left me counting fears in the darkened room.  

I left, counting fears in the darkened room,  
The shadows swayed, thick as unwelcome ghosts.  

The shadows swayed, thick as unwelcome ghosts,  
Each lightning crack sharp as a shouted demand.  

Each lightning crack sharp as a shouted demand—  
The sky unzipped, spilling over shivering ground.  

The sky unzipped, spilling over shivering ground,  
Wind pressed its knuckles hard against the glass.  

Wind pressed its knuckles hard against the glass.  
The storm slammed its fists on the porch at midnight.

subject: youth
poem_text:
Youth lingers like the echo of a song,  
A melody that fades as days grow long.  

A melody that fades as days grow long,  
Each note held close before it turns all wrong.  

Each note held close before it turns all wrong—  
We sang of love but quiet stole the throng.  

We sang of love but quiet stole the throng,  
Soft nights collapsed beneath a breaking dawn.  

Soft nights collapsed beneath a breaking dawn,  
The stars we wished on slipped away, withdrawn.  

The stars we wished on slipped away, withdrawn—  
Who knew their brightness wasn’t meant to stay?  

Who knew their brightness wasn’t meant to stay?  
Youth lingers like the echo of a song.

subject: youth
poem_text:
I held each morning like a fragile thread.  
The dawn unraveled quicker than I thought.  

The dawn unraveled quicker than I thought,  
Its light slipped past my grasping hands and fled.  

Its light slipped past my grasping hands and fled,  
And shadows grew where once the sun had caught.  

And shadows grew where once the sun had caught,  
A fleeting warmth now cold, but softly spread.  

A fleeting warmth now cold, but softly spread—  
The sky I loved is quiet, streaked with doubt.  

The sky I loved is quiet, streaked with doubt,  
Its vast expanse no longer burns bright red.  

Its vast expanse no longer burns bright red—  
I held each morning like a fragile thread.

subject: youth
poem_text:
The skateboard rattled loud beneath dim light,  
A song of yearning stretched against the dark.  

A song of yearning stretched against the dark,  
Soft wheels hummed hymns to shadows barely seen.  

Soft wheels hummed hymns to shadows barely seen,  
The pavement kissed your balance, sharp and clean.  

The pavement kissed your balance, sharp and clean,  
While dusk dissolved into the arms of night.  

While dusk dissolved into the arms of night,  
Our plans burned reckless, fragile as this glide.  

Our plans burned reckless, fragile as this glide,  
Chasing youth’s shimmer down an endless street.  

Chasing youth’s shimmer down an endless street,  
The skateboard rattled loud beneath dim light.

subject: abuse
poem_text:
The bruise speaks what the mouth cannot confess, 
A silence grows where once a heart could rest. 

A silence grows where once a heart could rest, 
Bruised by hands that claimed to love the best. 

Bruised by hands that claimed to love the best, 
A cycle spins, a shadow's cruel bequest. 

A cycle spins, a shadow's cruel bequest, 
The fragile soul folds under such duress. 

The fragile soul folds under such duress, 
Yet seeks the light, a chance to coalesce. 

Yet seeks the light, a chance to coalesce, 
To lift beyond the weight it had suppressed. 

To lift beyond the weight it had suppressed, 
The bruise speaks what the mouth cannot confess.The duplex, as inspired by poet Jericho Brown, allows for a meditative repetition and cyclical resonance, which feels uniquely suited to tackling heavy, painful themes like abuse.

subject: abuse
poem_text:
The silence leaves its bruise upon the air. 
An absence takes the shape of what was there. 

The shape of what was there turns sharp, then soft 
A whisper louder than the noise it's lost. 

This whisper carves the skin it longs to mend, 
The way a wound will ache before it bends. 

And bending, learns the contours of the night, 
The moon hung low, a blade that cuts the light. 

What cuts the light can hollow out the dark, 
A shadow's edge that maps an unseen mark. 

That mark, the echo carried in the chest 
A weight that dims each word, each long request. 

The silence leaves its bruise upon the air. 
We bear it all, though no one knows it's there.The form's circular nature mirrors the cycles of harm and survival while drawing on the haunting trace abuse leaves behind in human experiences.

subject: abuse
poem_text:
The house fell silent each time his voice rose. 
His shadow lingered longer than the light. 

His shadow lingered longer than the light, 
A bruise stretched across the frame of our lives. 

A bruise stretched across the frame of our lives, 
How do you rewrite a story carved in stone? 

How do you rewrite a story carved in stone 
Each wound handed down, a name etched inside? 

Each wound handed down, a name etched inside. 
We learned to wear silence like second skin. 

We learned to wear silence like second skin, 
Afraid to breathe, lest the walls hear us speak. 

Afraid to breathe, lest the walls hear us speak, 
We became echoes trapped between his fists. 

We became echoes trapped between his fists. 
The house fell silent each time his voice rose.This piece demonstrates the cyclical, perpetuating nature of abuse, reflecting how silence and fear become legacies within a family. The duplex form's repetition mirrors the inescapable loop of power and pain.

subject: activities
poem_text:
The rhythm of days sways steady like breath, 
Waves of motion whispered past morning's calm. 

Waves of motion stir, unraveling calm, 
Shoes laced tight in the hush of the dawn. 

Shoes laced tight to meet each pulsing dawn, 
We carve time's flesh with measured strides. 

We carve time's flesh with games and strides, 
Beneath sunlit air or soft, trembling rain. 

Beneath soft rain, the world feels wide again, 
Books close gently as pages turn. 

Books close gently, their echoes churn 
The rhythm of days sways steady like breath.

subject: activities
poem_text:
Each motion carves a story in the wind, 
Hands shaping hours before time slips away. 

Hands shaping hours before time slips away, 
Feet trace the ground, marking moments you claim. 

Feet trace the ground, marking moments you claim, 
A rhythm in steps carried by quiet fire. 

A rhythm in steps carried by quiet fire, 
Every gesture becomes a world reborn. 

Every gesture becomes a world reborn, 
The breath you spend returns, singing its name. 

The breath you spend returns, singing its name 
The sky opens, asking for your embrace.

subject: activities
poem_text:
The hands hold purpose in their careful grip, 
Shaping soft clay to bowls that cradle dreams. 

Shaping soft clay, a wheel begins to spin, 
The blur of motion steady with intent. 

The blur of motion masks an artist's breath, 
Each push and pull a whisper of a song. 

Each push and pull carves time into a shape, 
A rhythm born from patience and return. 

A rhythm honing worlds within these hands, 
Here, the silence speaks of all they've touched. 

The silence hums; the bowls now rest, complete, 
The hands hold purpose in their careful grip.

subject: arts & sciences
poem_text:
The canvas meets the formula's refrain, 
A dance of color with the laws of space. 

Where thought and feeling harmonize like rain, 
We map the stars, yet sketch the human face. 

The numbers whisper truths that few can frame. 
Still, paint will drip to tell what words can't trace. 

Though atoms burn, their bonds might still remain 
Arts and sciences, bound in shared embrace.

subject: arts & sciences
poem_text:
A dance of minds in shadowed halls, 
Where forms and theories echo deep. 

Where forms and theories echo deep, 
Each stroke, each proof, a mark to keep. 

Each stroke, each proof, a mark to keep, 
Unveiling what we cannot name. 

Unveiling what we cannot name, 
The whispered stars, the sculpted flame. 

The whispered stars, the sculpted flame, 
Harmony breeds as reason calls. 

Harmony breeds as reason calls 
The boundless quest for truth and sight.

subject: arts & sciences
poem_text:
The night sky opens like a painted page, 
Swirling secrets mirror the artist's hand. 

Swirling secrets churn in the scientist's cage, 
Where numbers and symbols seek to understand. 

Numbers chart the drifting of cosmic haze, 
But how can they capture the glowing thread? 

To paint the infinite is the artist's gaze, 
Tracing light that spills from the universe's bed. 

Tracing light and formula we weave and rave, 
The mind a brush, the heart a telescope's lens. 

What we seektruth or beautyneither can save, 
But still, we create, where the great arc bends.

subject: christianity
poem_text:
In silence, the cross bears its weight unseen, 
The burden of grace whispers soft as wind. 

The burden of grace whispers soft as wind, 
Unfolding mercy in hearts once bound tight. 

Unfolding mercy in hearts once bound tight, 
We find Christ's wounds are where healing begins. 

We find Christ's wounds are where healing begins, 
A tomb turned doorway leads to endless light. 

A tomb turned doorway leads to endless light, 
Risen love calling the dead into life. 

Risen love calling the dead into life, 
Each prayer a spark, aflame in dusk's long hymn. 

Each prayer a spark, aflame in dusk's long hymn, 
In silence, the cross bears its weight unseen.The Duplex form, created by Jericho Brown, melds elements of the sonnet, ghazal, and blues traditions, and I aimed to honor that structure while reflecting on themes central to Christianity.

subject: christianity
poem_text:
The weight of light rests heavy on the soul, 
A spark that flickers, whispering of home. 

A spark that flickers, whispering of home 
Its warmth a guide when shadows close in tight. 

Its warmth a guide when shadows close in tight, 
A narrow thread through valleys dim with gray. 

A narrow thread through valleys dim with gray, 
Each step a prayer, each breath a quiet plea. 

Each step a prayer, each breath a quiet plea, 
For hands unseen to carry what we bear. 

For hands unseen to carry what we bear, 
A grace that meets us where we are, undone. 

A grace that meets us where we are, undone. 
The weight of light rests heavy on the soul.

subject: christianity
poem_text:
I broke the loaf; its crust shed dust like ash. 
The body given breaks to fill the soul. 

The body given breaks to fill the soul 
A crumb of grace: enough to make me whole. 

A crumb of grace: enough to make me whole, 
Though bitter roots can cling like weeds to hope. 

Though bitter roots can cling like weeds to hope, 
Wine lifts a sweetness, cleansing as it flows. 

Wine lifts a sweetness, cleansing as it flows, 
A crimson thread that binds what tore apart. 

A crimson thread that binds what tore apart 
His blood transfigures grief into a spark. 

His blood transfigures grief into a spark. 
I broke the loaf; its crust shed dust like ash.

subject: chronic illness
poem_text:
The body betrays as though it is art. 
Each ache paints a silence, a private war. 

Each ache paints a silence, a private war, 
Time stretches its fingers, slow and raw. 

Time stretches its fingers, slow and raw, 
Yet pain finds a way to be what I know. 

Yet pain finds a way to be what I know, 
Its rhythm a dance that stifles my soul. 

Its rhythm a dance that stifles my soul, 
The days fold inward, yet still I grow. 

The days fold inward, yet still I grow, 
Marking my place where shadows have sewn. 

Marking my place where shadows have sewn, 
The body betrays as though it is art.

subject: chronic illness
poem_text:
Some days the body feels like bitter rain, 
A storm that comes but never moves away. 

A storm that comes but never moves away, 
Its weight sits still, a word you cannot say. 

Its weight sits still, a word you cannot say, 
Yet in your silence, pain begins to sing. 

Yet in your silence, pain begins to sing 
A hymn of aching bones and shadowed skin. 

A hymn of aching bones and shadowed skin 
Wears down the hours until there's none to spend. 

Wears down the hours until there's none to spend, 
And still, you wake and rise to meet the storm. 

And still, you wake and rise to meet the storm, 
Some days the body feels like bitter rain.

subject: chronic illness
poem_text:
The body grows tired under the weight 
Each sunrise feels like the same old refrain. 
 
Each sunrise feels like the same old refrain, 
Time stretches thin, a tether without end. 
 
Time stretches thin, a tether without end, 
Doctors speak in riddles, answers deferred. 
 
Doctors speak in riddles, answers deferred, 
The waiting room hums with fluorescent ache. 
 
The waiting room hums with fluorescent ache 
Chairs hold the shape of hope long abandoned. 
 
Chairs hold the shape of hope long abandoned, 
The body grows tired under the weight.

subject: crime & punishment
poem_text:
A shadow sharpens where guilt bends the light, 
The weight of sin turns justice into fight. 

The weight of sin turns justice into fight, 
A gavel echoes, cracking endless night. 

A gavel echoes, cracking endless night 
Chains hum the songs of men erased from sight. 

Chains hum the songs of men erased from sight, 
Their voices buried, silenced in their plight. 

Their voices buried, silenced in their plight, 
A mother wails for sons lost to the blight. 

A mother wails for sons lost to the blight; 
Who pays the cost for what's defined as right? 

Who pays the cost for what's defined as right? 
A shadow sharpens where guilt bends the light.This poem explores the cyclical, systemic nature of crime and punishment and the human toll it exacts. Let me know how else I can help!

subject: crime & punishment
poem_text:
The consequence of deeds too sharp to name 
Collects in shadows cast by brittle oaths. 

Collected shadows stretch through brittle oaths 
A wound, invisible, yet always felt. 

A wound, invisible, yet always felt, 
Becomes the weight no hand can lift away. 

The weight no hand can lift away still grows, 
Its roots entwined with every fleeting breath. 

Entwined with roots, the fleeting breath resists 
But silence knows the burden it must bear. 

The burden silence knows, the crooked line, 
A darkness lingers in the quiet air.

subject: crime & punishment
poem_text:
The knife was hidden deep inside the drain. 
A lie will carve its path into the bone. 

A lie will carve its path into the bone. 
Shards of truth splinter like glass in the dark. 

Shards of truth splinter like glass in the dark. 
The clock struck twelve; no car was on the road. 

The clock struck twelve; no car was on the road. 
Each silence splits, each shadow knows its part. 

Each silence splits, each shadow knows its part. 
The tape rewinds but never clears my name. 

The tape rewinds but never clears my name. 
That single breathtoo sharperased the calm. 

That single breathtoo sharperased the calm. 
The knife was hidden deep inside the drain.

subject: cycles
poem_text:
The sun sinks low and rises once again, 
A promise kept, much like it was back then. 

A promise kept, much like the turning wheel, 
Time folds in loops, repeating what we feel. 

Time folds in loops, repeating what we've known, 
Days echo days, the seeds of past are sown. 

Days echo days, the tide retreats, returns, 
Gray ash from fires rebuilds where ruin burns. 

Gray ash from fires rebuilds the earth anew, 
We learn, forgetwe leave, yet always move. 

We learn, forgetwe break, reform the chain, 
The sun sinks low and rises once again.

subject: cycles
poem_text:
Morning falls in patterns, soft and clear. 
Soft and clear, the stars dissolve to sky. 

The stars dissolve to sky, then reappear 
Night will dress the land where daylight dies. 

Daylight dies, but time is not unkind. 
Not unkind, the seasons trade their hues. 

The seasons trade their hues, and we unwind, 
While shadows trace the footprints we outgrew. 

The footprints we outgrew will fade and turn. 
Still, morning falls in patterns, soft and clear.

subject: cycles
poem_text:
The trees let loose their leaves, a breath let go, 
A circle spins as nature starts anew. 

A circle spins as nature starts anew, 
The frost lays claim, then melts in springtime's glow. 

The frost lays claim, then melts in springtime's glow, 
And buds emerge where barren limbs once grew. 

And buds emerge where barren limbs once grew, 
Time folds softlyits rhythm whispers low. 

Time folds softlyits rhythm whispers low, 
A humming cycle countless creatures know. 

A humming cycle countless creatures know, 
The trees let loose their leaves, a breath let go.

subject: desire & passion
poem_text:
This glow, a whisper seared against the dark, 
Clings tight to skin, an ache that doesn't rest. 

It clings to skin, this ache that doesn't rest, 
A river running deep where all begins. 

The river runs so deep where all begins, 
Erasing boundaries carved by timid hands. 

It chafes at boundaries carved by timid hands, 
Its shape unbroken, fevered in its want. 

This fevered want, unbroken in its shape, 
Becomes the thread that ties us to the fire. 

That thread still ties us close against the fire, 
Beneath the weight of breath, the flame unfolds.

subject: desire & passion
poem_text:
I listen to the thunder, a low, wet moan 
The sky aches, wanting what it cannot hold. 

This sky aches, wanting what it cannot hold. 
Rain spills like hands trembling for someone. 

Rain spills like hands trembling for someone. 
A longing that drowns before it can speak. 

This longing drownsbefore it can speak, 
It pools between stones, restless and alive. 

Pooling between stones, restless and alive, 
The earth drinks it in, never satisfied. 

The earth drinks it in, never satisfied 
I watch, my breath tight, waiting for the flood. 

Breath tight, I wait, a flood inside my chest. 
I listen to the thunder, a low, wet moan.

subject: doubt & contemplation
poem_text:
The weight of doubt sits heavy in the chest, 
Its voice a whisper swaying every thought. 

Its voice, a whisper swaying every thought, 
Turns certainty to fog, the clear to naught. 

Turn certainty to fog, the clear to naught 
What truths remain when reason starts to wane? 

What truths remain? When reason starts to wane, 
The mind repeats each question as refrain. 

The mind repeats each question as refrain, 
And contemplation circles back to fear. 

In contemplation, circles back to fear, 
The answers lie, but stay just out of reach. 

The answers lie, but stay just out of reach 
The weight of doubt sits heavy in the chest.

subject: doubt & contemplation
poem_text:
Each step I take feels both too fast and slow, 
A trembling thread stretched taut beneath my weight. 

A trembling thread stretched taut beneath my weight, 
The quiet hum of questions pulls me back. 

The quiet hum of questions pulls me back, 
A whisper rising louder in my chest. 

A whisper rising louder in my chest, 
Unseen winds tug me toward an unknown edge. 

Unseen winds tug me toward an unknown edge, 
The ground dissolves, yet still my feet must move. 

The ground dissolves, yet still my feet must move. 
A fractured mirror holds my searching face. 

A fractured mirror holds my searching face. 
Each step I take feels both too fast and slow.

subject: doubt & contemplation
poem_text:
I found an envelope sealed up in dust, 
Its address worn by hands that hesitate. 

Its address worn by hands that hesitate 
What truth do secrets hold, tethered in ink? 

What truth do secrets hold, tethered in ink? 
It hums between my fingers, cold and still. 

It hums between my fingers, cold and still: 
The tremor of choiceopen or forget? 

The tremor of choiceopen or forget, 
Letters can carve or soothe, but never lie. 

Letters can carve or soothe, but never lie, 
Yet silence screams a question: What remains? 

Yet silence screams a question: What remains? 
I found an envelope sealed up in dust.

subject: family & ancestors
poem_text:
We carry their voices in the marrow of our days, 
The whispers of kin stirring the marrow of time. 

The whispers of kin braid our lives into theirs, 
Each branch a memory that knots into bone. 

Each branch a memory, its green never fades 
Our bloodline stretched wide, spanning farther than sight. 

Our bloodline stretched wide, though its roots hold tight, 
Feeding us stories of dawns lost to dusk. 

Feeding us stories, they shape the words we speak, 
Their echoes resound like a hymn through the dark. 

Their echoes resound, where the past flickers bright, 
We carry their voices in the marrow of our days.This structure emphasizes repetition and connection, much like the ties between family and ancestors. It mirrors how history and lineage loop through generations, always present and anchoring us.

subject: family & ancestors
poem_text:
These echoes hum like lullabies at dusk, 
Faint voices carried home by autumn winds. 

The wind repeats the things we've left unsaid, 
A bridge of breath that ties the old to new. 

Each tie becomes a thread we cannot see, 
Yet pulls us toward the roots we call our own. 

Our hands are shaped by hands we'll never know, 
Their shadows guide the way we move through light. 

The light bends back to where the first step fell 
The earth remembers footsteps through the soil.

subject: family & ancestors
poem_text:
What binds us lives beneath the skin, unseen. 
The whispered stories echo in my veins. 

The whispered stories echo in my veins 
A lullaby my grandmother hums in dreams. 

A lullaby my grandmother hums in dreams, 
Her voice a thread I follow through the dark. 

Her voice, a threadI follow through the dark 
To find my father's calloused hands, his work. 

I find my father's calloused hands, his work: 
The wooden table carved from ancient roots. 

The wooden table carved from ancient roots 
This gathering place where time folds into now. 

This gathering place where time folds into now, 
Where what binds us lives beneath the skin, unseen.

subject: gender & sexuality
poem_text:
The body speaks in languages we cannot name, 
Each whisper shaped by a history of shame. 

Each whisper shaped by a history of shame, 
Yet blossoms bloom where wildness won't tame. 

Yet blossoms bloom where wildness won't tame, 
A boy unlearns himself, a girl sheds her frame. 

A boy unlearns himself, a girl sheds her frame, 
Softness lingers where they refuse to claim. 

Softness lingers where they refuse to claim, 
How we live in the borderlands of the same. 

How we live in the borderlands of the same, 
The self makes light from boundaries it maims. 

The body speaks in languages we cannot name, 
Hands charting a map no two lives could frame.Let me know if you'd like to explore or refine it further!

subject: gender & sexuality
poem_text:
Something sacred hums beneath the skin, 
A language the body learns to speak. 

The body learns to speak strange truths 
Reflected mirrors, shifting shapes. 

Reflected mirrors shift and sigh 
Names dissolve, then form anew. 

A name, a form, a fleeting pulse 
What remains is honest light. 

What remains is honest light, 
A way to hold the self in bloom. 

To hold oneself in bloom, unbound, 
Is to hum the sacred beneath the skin.Let me know if you'd like me to refine or revise it!

subject: gender & sexuality
poem_text:
The river splits itself to hold many forms, 
A current gentle, yet strong in its flow. 

A current gentleyet strong in its flow 
It carves its path beyond what's been named. 

It carves its path beyond what's been named, 
Refusing the banks that would cage its depth. 

Refusing the banks that would cage its depth, 
It swells with life too vast to confine. 

It swells with life too vast to confine, 
Changing colors like twilight painted skies. 

Changing colors like twilight painted skies, 
Each hue a truth soft-spoken, yet pure. 

Each hue a truth soft-spoken, yet pure 
The river splits itself to hold many forms.

subject: greek & roman mythology
poem_text:
Stories spiral in woven threads of time, 
Threads that whisper gods' cryptic design.

Gods' cryptic design etched in mortal strife, 
Heroes rise and fall on the loom of life.

The loom of life spins fate by unseen hands, 
Athena watches, guiding human plans.

Guiding human plans, yet chaos takes root, 
Zeus casts thunder, his will an absolute.

His will an absolutea fire to shape, 
Furies chase the guilty, there is no escape.

There is no escape from prophecy's sting, 
Apollo's lyre hums what the Oracles sing.

The Oracles sing, yet silence holds the past. 
Stories spiral in woven threads that last.

subject: greek & roman mythology
poem_text:
Marble bones remember, they never forget, 
The clash of wings and mortals' secrets met. 

Secrets met where rivers twist and burn, 
A pyre of myths where constellations turn. 

Constellations turn, their stories spun in air, 
Furies and muses tangling in despair. 

Despair shapes the wind, the ocean's cry, 
Echoes of prayers hurled to a shadowed sky. 

To a shadowed sky, they sent their pleas, 
Hoping to bind their fate to skies and seas. 

Skies and seas whisper on ancient stone, 
Calling forth tales of the world we've known.

subject: greek & roman mythology
poem_text:
The sun bore witness to our fleeting dreams, 
Dreams that rise like wings, yet fall so fast. 

Wings that rise, though bound to the wax of fate, 
Fate whispers warnings, but we crave the heights. 

We crave the heights where gods watch men ascend, 
Ascend too far, and flames will claim your pride. 

Pride bends the air, the fragile sky folds in,
